Mario Puratić's mechanical power block	Mehanički koloturnik Marija Puratića	0.3
A truffle, a fungus that grows underground.	Tartuf, gljiva s podzemnim plodištem.	0.274286
They are highly prized as a delicacy and are extremely expensive.	Tartufi su cijenjeni kao poslastica, te postižu visoku cijenu.	0.3
Truffle-hunting and cooking have developed in Istria. ~~~ It was in this region that the world's largest truffle, weighing 1.310 kg, was discovered.	Skupljanje i pripremanje tartufa razvijeno je u Istri, gdje je 1999. pronađen najveći tartuf na svijetu (1,310 kg).	-0.0371287
		0.3
The main feature of Croatian cuisine is its diversity, so it is impossible to single out a typical cuisine or typical dish.	Glavno je obilježje hrvatske kuhinje njezina raznolikost, te nije moguće izdvojiti tipičnu kuhinju ili tipično jelo.	0.291262
Different natural and economic circumstances and diverse cultural influences have affected the development of several regional cuisines.	Različiti prirodni i gospodarski uvjeti te raznovrsni kulturni utjecaji uvjetovali su razvoj više regionalnih kuhinja.	0.260748
Four main areas can be identified, but each of these has several subgroups with their own specific characteristics and specialities.	Izdvajaju se četiri veća područja, a svako od njih ima potpodručja sa svojim specifičnostima i specijalitetima.	0.264706
The Adriatic coast belongs to the Mediterranean world of cuisine.	Jadranska je obala i kulinarski dio sredozemnoga svijeta.	0.264706
The food is light and includes a lot of fish and other seafood – cuttlefish, squid, octopus and shellfish.	Prehrana je lagana, s mnogobrojnim jelima od ribe i drugih plodova mora – sipa, lignji, hobotnice, školjaka.	0.450183
These are stewed, casseroled, grilled or roasted.	Od njih se rade buzare, brudeti, peku se na gradelama ili ispod peke.	0.204545
Plenty of vegetables, legumes and wild plants (wild asparagus, meadow plants – mišanca) are also eaten.	Jede se puno povrća, grahorica, ali i samoniklog bilja (divlje šparoge, livadno bilje, mišanca).	0.282759
They are made into soups (maneštra), or steamed or boiled and seasoned with olive oil and garlic.	Od povrća se rade jušni složenci (maneštre) ili se priprema na lešo, kuhano i začinjeno maslinovim uljem i češnjakom.	0.209639
Olive oil is the basic culinary addition.	Maslinovo ulje osnovni je začin jelima.	0.3
The most frequently prepared meats are mutton, and to a lesser extent, beef.	Od mesa se najčešće priprema ovčetina, rjeđe junetina i govedina.	0.285484
A favourite beef dish is pašticada, braised with herbs, prunes and dried figs, bacon and red wine, and the most common accompaniments are potato noodles (gnocchi).	Omiljeno je jelo od govedine pašticada, koja se priprema pirjanjem uz dodatak začinskoga bilja, suhih šljiva i smokava, slanine te crnoga vina, a najčešći su prilog njoki (valjušci od krumpirova tijesta).	0.321111
Pork is smoked and air-dried to produce proscuitto and pancetta.	Od svinjetine se dimljenjem i sušenjem na otvorenom rade pršut i panceta.	0.251786
The most famous hard cheese is goat’s cheese from the island of Pag.	Među sirevima je najpoznatiji suhi ovčji sir s otoka Paga.	0.259615
		0.3
The cuisine of Lika and Gorski Kotar is most meat-based: lamb, kid, beef and some pork.	U kuhinji Like i Gorskoga kotara češća su jela od mesa: janjetine, kozletine, govedine, manje svinjetine.	0.213699
Meat is cooked with beans and pickled cabbage or turnip, grilled or roasted, and may be smoke-dried.	Meso se kuha s grahom, kiselim zeljem ili repom, peče na žaru ili ispod peke, suši na dimu.	0.273077
The most common accompaniments are potatoes (ličke pole).	Kao prilog najčešći je krumpir (ličke pole).	0.987209
Game is also eaten, particularly venison or boar goulash.	Poznata su i jela od mesa divljači, posebno gulaši od srnetine ili veprovine.	0.192
Various kinds of mushrooms grow plentifully in the woods.	Jedu se različite vrste gljiva kojima obiluju tamošnje šume.	0.264
The diet of these predominantly cattle-farming areas also includes plenty of dairy produce, such as the famous Lika cheese, škripavac.	Kuhinja tih, tradicionalno stočarskih, krajeva bogata je i mliječnim proizvodima, poput poznatoga ličkog sira škripavca.	0.283784
		0.3
Dairy products are also part of the cuisine of northern and central Croatia.	Mliječne prerađevine zastupljene su i u kuhinji sjeverne i središnje Hrvatske.	0.267692
Soft cow’s cheese, eaten with sour cream, is popular, as is podravska prga, a dried cheese seasoned with paprika and garlic. ~~~ Sour cream is often added to stews and soups.	Poznati su svježi meki kravlji sir, koji se jede s vrhnjem, ili podravske prge, sušeni sir začinjen crvenom paprikom i češnjakom.Vrhnje se koristi i kao dodatak varivima i juhama.	-0.0113014
Meat is usually poultry or pork.	Najčešće se jede meso peradi i svinjetina.	0.171429
Turkey with mlinci, a side-dish of unleavened pastry, is one of the most famous dishes in Croatian Zagorje and the Zagreb area.	Pečena purica s mlincima, prilogom od beskvasnog tijesta, jedno je od najpoznatijih jela Hrvatskoga zagorja i zagrebačke okolice.	0.27757
Štrukli, filled pastry turnovers, are another popular dish.	Štrukli, savijača od vučenog tijesta, najpopularnije je jelo s toga područja.	0.533333
They can be sweet or savoury, boiled or baked, added to soup, filled with soft cheese, apples, pumpkin, poppy seeds, millet, etc. ~~~ Dishes made from buckwheat, millet and barley used to be common, but these ingredients are less frequent on modern menus.	Mogu biti slani ili slatki, kuhani ili pečeni, ili na juhu, s nadjevom od sira, jabuka, bundeve, maka, prosene kaše i dr. Nekada su se pripremala i jela od heljdine, prosene ili ječmene kaše, a te su namirnice sve češće i na suvremenom jelovniku.	-0.0014218
		0.3
The culinary tradition of northeast Croatia (Slavonia and Baranja) relies heavily on pork, whether fresh or processed as dried products – sausages, bacon, ham, pork crackling, or the famous kulen and kulenova seka (types of salami).	U kulinarskoj tradiciji sjeveroistočne Hrvatske (Slavonija, Baranja) bitnu ulogu ima svinjetina, svježe pripremljena ili prerađena u suhomesnate proizvode – kobasice, slaninu, šunku, čvarke ili poznate kulen i kulenovu seku.	0.594
Čobanac is a goulash made with several kinds of meat, served with potatoes or dumplings.	Poznato je jelo čobanac, gulaš od više vrsta mesa, s krumpirom ili žličnjacima.	0.287671
River fish are used to make paprikaš.	Od riječne ribe priprema se paprikaš.	0.71039
Dishes are seasoned generously with paprika.	Jela su jako začinjena ljutom crvenom paprikom.	0.2775
Lard is used to make lard cakes (salenjaci).	Od svinjskog se sala rade poznati kolači salenjaci.	0.236842
		0.3
Fine food and drink are an integral part of the traditions of the Croatian regions and an important factor in their contemporary identities.	Gastronomija je neizostavni dio tradicije hrvatskih regija i važan čimbenik njihova suvremenog identiteta.	0.231959
One component is the range of different gourmet treats for tourists – truffles in Istria, chestnuts in Kvarner, the ‘What our Ancestors Ate’ festival in Vrbovec – and restaurants and rural farms which offer traditionally prepared dishes, or those based on tradition, but adapted to modern culinary principles.	Sastavni je dio turističke ponude različitih gastronomskih priredaba tartufa u Istri, marunada na Kvarneru, manifestacije Kaj su jeli naši stari u Vrbovcu – restorana i seljačkih gospodarstava koja nude jela pripremljena na tradicionalan način ili ona što se temelje na tradiciji, ali su prilagođena suvremenim kulinarskim načelima.	0.333718

Orahnjača (orehnjača), a cake from northern parts, made with yeast dough and filled with ground walnuts	Orahnjača (orehnjača), slatko jelo sjevernih krajeva, dizano tijesto s nadjevom od mljevenih oraha.	0.725238
Ban Josip Jelačić Square in Zagreb, capital of Croatia.	Trg bana Josipa Jelačića u Zagrebu, glavnom gradu Hrvatske.	0.276
Zagreb, which has about 700,000 inhabitants, is home to one in six inhabitants of Croatia.	U Zagrebu, koji ima oko 700&nbsp;000 stanovnika, živi svaki &scaron;esti stanovnik Hrvatske.	0.276623
		0.3
Croatia has been present on the contemporary international political stage since its independence from the Yugoslav Federation, i.e. ~~~ for a little over two decades,   but in terms of history and culture, it is one of the oldest European countries.	Na suvremenoj međunarodnoj političkoj pozornici Hrvatska je nazočna od državnog osamostaljenja iz jugoslavenske federacije, dakle tek nešto više od dva desetljeća, no po svojoj povijesti i kulturi ona je jedna od starijih europskih zemalja.	-0.00140845
The present-day territory of Croatia and its borders were formed over a long period of history, during which the Croatian nation, whether independent or incorporated within other states, constantly displayed its own subjectivity in national and political terms.	Današnji hrvatski teritorij i granice oblikovani su kroz dugotrajnu povijest, tijekom koje je hrvatski narod, bilo samostalno, bilo u okviru različitih državnih zajednica, kontinuirano iskazivao nacionalni i politički subjektivitet.	0.277033
The geopolitical situation of Croatia is determined, therefore, by the convergence and influence of different ethnic, religious, economic and political factors.	Geopolitički položaj Hrvatske određen je, stoga, dodirom i utjecajima različitih etničkih, vjerskih, gospodarskih i političkih čimbenika.	0.274615
With respect to the complex position of the country, Croatian authors usually define it as Central European and Mediterranean.	Uvažavajući složen položaj svoje zemlje, hrvatski je autori najčešće definiraju kao srednjoeuropsku i sredozemnu.	0.297222
		0.3
According to the predominant historical orientation of most of the present-day territory, which gravitated towards Vienna and Budapest, and according to the geographical characteristics of its continental interior, Croatia is a Central European country.	Prema pretežitoj povijesnoj orijentaciji većeg dijela svojega današnjeg teritorija prema Beču i Budimpešti, kao i prema zemljopisnim obilježjima svoje kontinentalne unutrašnjosti, Hrvatska je srednjoeuropska zemlja.	0.266834
On the other hand, its exceptionally long sea front which, with the immediate inland region, fell under the historical influence of the powers of Venice, make it a Mediterranean country.	S druge strane, iznimno dugačko morsko pročelje, koje je s neposrednom unutrašnjošću povijesno bilo pod presudnim utjecajem maritimne sile Venecije, čini je sredozemnom zemljom.	0.294304
In the hinterland of the Adriatic coast, in a triangle formed by the towns of Nin, Knin and Šibenik, the seeds of the first medieval Croatian state were sown.	U zaleđu jadranske obale, u trokutu gradova Nin–Knin–Šibenik, bila je i jezgra prvotne srednjovjekovne hrvatske države.	0.246429
The general shift of economic centres of gravity to the north in Europe, and Croatia’s entry into a state connection with Hungary, moved the centre of gravity of the Croatian state towards Zagreb.	Općim pomicanjem gospodarskog težišta u Europi prema sjeveru te ulaskom Hrvatske u državne veze s Ugarskom, pomaknulo se i hrvatsko državno težište prema Zagrebu.	0.259184
In the wider context of the Croatian region, several powerful political, economic and civilisational centres developed through the ages (the Ancient Greeks, the Romans, the Byzantines, the Franks, the Hungarians, the Ottomans, and the Venetians).	U širem okruženju hrvatskog područja razvilo se tijekom povijesti nekoliko moćnih političkih i gospodarskih, a i civilizacijskih središta (starogrčko, rimsko, bizantsko, franačko, ugarsko, osmansko, venecijansko).	0.277273
Their influences permeated the region of Croatia, and were often in conflict with each other.	Njihovi su se utjecaji na području Hrvatske prožimali, a nerijetko i sukobljivali.	0.275676
In the division caused by the schism in Christianity, Croatia leaned to the Western faction, at the same time forming the far eastern border of Western Christianity.	U podjeli uvjetovanoj raskolom kršćanstva Hrvatska se priklonila zapadnomu dijelu, tvoreći ujedno njegov istočni granični rub.	0.241026
Long periods of conflict between mighty powers, punctuated by occasional times of peace, meant that the survival of Croatia was constantly jeopardised and national development hindered.	Dugotrajni sukobi moćnih sila, uz tek iznimna mirnodopska razdoblja, značili su stalnu prijetnju opstojnosti Hrvatske i prepreku nacionalnomu razvitku.	0.244853
Several times, foreign powers organised their military defence systems on Croatian land (e.g.	U nekoliko navrata izvanjska su središta na hrvatskom području organizirala vojne obrambene sustave (npr.	0.252439
the Frankish Eastern Line and the Austrian Military Border).	franačke istočne marke, austrijska Vojna granica).	0.26875
Croatia was also on the route of the deepest incursions made by the Ottoman Empire into Central Europe, which led to the contraction of the Croatian state and the shrinking of the Croatian ethnic area to the west.	Hrvatska se našla i na putu najdubljeg prodora Osmanskoga Carstva prema središnjoj Europi, što je uzrokovalo sažimanje hrvatske države te povlačenje hrvatskoga etničkog područja prema zapadu.	0.296571
The final consequence of this situation meant that Croatia was shaped along the unusual contours of its modern state territory, arching widely around neighbouring Bosnia and Herzegovina.	Konačna je posljedica takva položaja Hrvatske neobičan oblik njezina suvremenoga državnog teritorija, koji u širokom luku zaokružuje susjednu Bosnu i Hercegovinu.	0.275839
The location of the country has brought it into contact with different cultures, traces of which can be found in various kinds of tangible and spiritual heritage, which today, alongside the original Croatian tradition, have been incorporated into the national identity and recognised in the European community of nations.	Položaj zemlje na dodiru različitih kultura ostavio je tragove u raznovrsnom materijalnom i duhovnom naslijeđu, koji su danas s izvornom hrvatskom tradicijom uklopljeni u vlastiti nacionalni identitet, prepoznatljiv u zajednici europskih naroda.	0.222936
The direct consequence of belonging to different political centres throughout history was the long and drawn-out period during which the Croatian lands, today’s historical regions, were not united.	Izravna posljedica pripadnosti različitim političkim centrima tijekom povijesti bila je dugotrajna razjedinjenost hrvatskih zemalja, današnjih povijesnih regija.	0.251678
Under these circumstances, the political genesis of Croatia was slow and protracted.	U takvim prilikama hrvatska politogeneza bila je otežana i usporena.	0.236066
After several centuries of political links with the Central European countries of Austria and Hungary, in 1918 Croatia became part of the Yugoslav state, whose centre of gravity was further east, so that through most of the 20th century, Croatian interests were subordinated to Yugoslav ones.	Nakon višestoljetnih političkih veza sa srednjoeuropskim zemljama Austrijom i Ugarskom Hrvatska 1918. ulazi u jugoslavensku državu, težište i središte koje je bilo istočnije, pa su u najvećem dijelu 20. st. hrvatski interesi bili podređeni jugoslavenskima.	0.27931
Nonetheless, within the framework of Yugoslavia, Croatia continued to develop its own potential and, occasionally, to express its own political goals.	Ipak i u okviru Jugoslavije Hrvatska je nastavila razvijati vlastite potencijale a povremeno i iskazivati političke ciljeve.	0.242727
In this situation of limited independence, Croatia succeeded after the Second World War in integrating most of its ethnic regions, then, during the disintegration of Yugoslavia, to mount a military defence and, after the collapse of the Eastern Bloc, to win the fight for international recognition.	U takvim uvjetima ograničene samostalnosti Hrvatska je nakon II. ~~~ svjetskog rata uspjela teritorijalno integrirati veći dio svojega etničkog područja, u uvjetima raspada Jugoslavije vojno ga obraniti te se, nakon sloma blokovske podjele u Europi, izboriti i za međunarodno priznanje.	-0.00119048
Croatia’s sovereignty and western orientation have been affirmed by entry into the European Union, and, once again, the country is in the position of being a border, which places it in a unique position to participate in the process of extending the European Union to non-member countries, by showing its special interest in them, and also its understanding of them.	Njezin suverenitet te vjekovna orijentacija prema Zapadu potvrđuje se i ulaskom u Europsku uniju u okviru koje još jednom zauzima granični položaj koji joj nalaže da s posebnim interesom i razumijevanjem sudjeluje u procesu širenja na preostale zemlje nečlanice.	0.199138

Anthem.	Himna.	0.257143
The national anthem is Lijepa naša domovino (Our Beautiful Homeland).	Nacionalna je himna Lijepa naša domovino.	0.967669
It first appeared during the period of national revival in the early 19th century. ~~~ The words were written by the poet Antun Mihanović and set to music by Josip Runjanin.	Nastala je u vrijeme narodnoga preporoda u prvoj polovici 19. st. Tekst je napisao pjesnik Antun Mihanović, a uglazbio ga Josip Runjanin.	0.17224
From 1891 onwards, it was the unofficial national anthem, and a monument to it was erected by the River Sutla in Croatian Zagorje in 1935.	Od 1891. prihvaćena je za neslužbenu nacionalnu himnu te joj je 1935. podignut i spomenik uz rijeku Sutlu u Hrvatskom zagorju.	0.41985
It was declared the official anthem of the Socialist Republic of Croatia in 1972, and confirmed by the Constitution in 1990.	Službenom himnom Socijalističke Republike Hrvatske proglašena je 1972, a potvrđena je i Ustavom 1990.	0.66129
Flag.	Zastava.	0.15
The official Croatian flag has three colours, red, white and blue, with the state coat of arms in the centre, and has been in use since 1990.	Službena hrvatska zastava sastoji se od tri boje: crvene, bijele i plave, s državnim grbom u sredini, a u uporabi je od 1990.	0.396698
The tricolour dates back to 1848, under the influence of the French Revolution, and was adopted as a means of linking the traditional heraldic colours of the historical Croatian lands.	Trobojnica se počela isticati 1848. pod utjecajem Francuske revolucije, a nastala je spajanjem tradicionalnih heraldičkih boja povijesnih hrvatskih zemalja.	0.268085
The Croato--Hungarian Settlement of 1868 prescribed the use of the tricolour, and it continued to be prominent in the 20th century, right up to the declaration of state independence.	Uporabu takve trobojnice propisala je i Hrvatsko-ugarska nagodba 1868, a isticala se i u 20. st. do proglašenja državne neovisnosti.	0.199138
Coat of arms.	Grb.	-0.12
The coat of arms has also been in use since 1990.	I grb je u službenoj uporabi od 1990.	0.558333
It is a historical Croatian coat of arms in the shape of an escutcheon divided into 25 red and white (silver) fields.	To je povijesni hrvatski grb u obliku štita, podijeljen na 25 crvenih i bijelih (srebrnih) polja.	2.19475
Five smaller escutcheons in the crown above have historical roots and are (from left) the oldest known Croatian coat of arms, then the coats of arms of the Dubrovnik Republic, Dalmatia, Istria and Slavonia.	Pet manjih štitova u kruni nad grbom povijesni su grbovi (s lijeva): najstariji poznati hrvatski grb te grbovi Dubrovačke Republike, Dalmacije, Istre i Slavonije.	0.232394
The historical Croatian coat of arms has appeared on different occasions from the 15th century on. ~~~ An example of it with 8 rows of 8 fields is found in the 1527 document which ratified the election by the Croatian Sabor of Ferdinand I of the Habsburgs as King of Croatia. ~~~ It later formed the basis for later Croatian coats of arms within the Habsburg Monarchy.	Povijesni hrvatski grb pojavljuje se u različitim prigodama od 15. st. Grb s 8 × 8 polja nalazio se 1527. na dokumentu kojim je Sabor potvrdio izbor Ferdinanda I. Habsburškoga za hrvatskoga kralja, te je postao osnovom kasnijih hrvatskih grbova u okviru Habsburške Monarhije.	-0.0859524
It was a component of the official coat of arms of the Socialist Republic of Croatia up to 1990.	Bio je i sastavni dio službenoga grba Socijalističke Republike Hrvatske do 1990.	0.501603
National holidays.	Nacionalni blagdani.	0.266667
Statehood Day is celebrated on 25 June, the date on which the Croatian Parliament (Sabor) declared the independence of the Republic of Croatia in 1991.	Dan državnosti obilježava se 25. lipnja, na datum kad je Hrvatski sabor 1991. proglasio neovisnost Republike Hrvatske.	0.400952
Other official national holidays are Independence Day (8 October), Victory and Homeland Thanksgiving Day and Day of Homeland Defenders (5 August), Anti-Fascist Struggle Day (22 June), International Workers’ Day (1 May) and New Year’s Day (1 January).	Službeni su nacionalni blagdani i Dan neovisnosti (8. listopada), Dan pobjede i domovinske zahvalnosti i dan hrvatskih branitelja (5. kolovoza), Dan antifašističke borbe (22. lipnja), Praznik rada (1. svibnja) i Nova godina.	0.266497
Some church holidays (Gregorian Calendar) are also non-working days: Epiphany, Easter Day, Corpus Christi, the Assumption, All Saints’ Day, Christmas Day and St. Stephen’s Day (Boxing Day).	Neradni su dani i crkveni blagdani prema gregorijanskom kalendaru: Sveta tri kralja, Uskrs, Tijelovo, Velika Gospa, Svi sveti, Božić i Sveti Stjepan.	0.215267
Christmas Day according to the Julian Calendar is a non-working day for those of the Orthodox faith, Ramadan Bayram and Kurban Bayram for those of the Moslem faith, and Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur for those of the Jewish faith.	Božić prema julijanskomu kalendaru neradni je dan za građane pravoslavne vjere, Ramazanski bajram i Kurban-bajram za građane islamske vjere te Roš hašana i Jom kipur za građane židovske vjere.	0.27052
		0.3
Did you know?	Jeste li znali?	0.25
Mt. ~~~ Velebit is included in the world network of biosphere reserves (UNESCO’s scientific programme Man and the Biosphere), while five areas are on the list of wetlands of international importance, particularly as ornithological habitats: Kopački Rit, Lonjsko Polje, the Neretva Delta, Crna Mlaka and Lake Vransko.	Planina Velebit uvrštena je u međunarodnu mrežu rezervata biosfere (UNESCO-ov znanstveni program Čovjek i biosfera), a pet je područja na međunarodnom popisu vrijednih močvara, osobito kao staništa ptica močvarica: Kopački rit, Lonjsko polje, Delta Neretve, Crna Mlaka i Vransko jezero.	0.177113
		0.3

The oldest surviving record of a session of the Sabor dates back to 1273.	Najstariji sačuvani zapisnik saborskoga zasjedanja potječe iz 1273.	0.623497
Until the 16th century, the Slavonian and Croatian Sabors sat separately, and from 1681, the Sabor of the Kingdom of Croatia, Dalmatia and Slavonia held sessions.	Do 16. st. zasjedaju odvojeno Slavonski i Hrvatski sabor, a od 1681. zasjeda Sabor Kraljevstava Hrvatske, Dalmacije i Slavonije.	0.377027
The official language was Latin, but this was replaced by Croatian in 1847.	Službeni jezik do 1847. bio je latinski, otad je hrvatski.	0.496257

Some of the most recent archaeological finds, which date back to approximately 6300 BC, indicate that Vinkovci (Slavonia) is the oldest European town, with an urban continuity of over 8,000 years.	Najnoviji arheološki nalazi koji datiraju iz približno 6300 pr. ~~~ Kr. ~~~ pokazuju na to da su Vinkovci (Slavonija) najstariji europski grad, s urbanim kontinuitetom starijim od osam tisućljeća.	0.812069
		0.3

Taking the surface area of the country and the number of inhabitants into account, Croatia leads the countries of Southeast Europe in terms of highways, and is ahead of many other members of the European Union. The Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts is the oldest in Southeast Europe (1866) and has up to 160 full members (academicians).	Hrvatska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti, najstarija u jugoistočnoj Europi (1866), ima do 160 redovitih članova (akademika).	2.23292
		0.3
Did you know?	Jeste li znali?	0.25
A portrait of the Croatian miniaturist Julije Klović, dated 1570, is the earliest surviving portrait by the great Spanish painter and sculptor of Greek origin, El Greco.	Portret hrvatskog minijaturista Julija Klovića iz 1570. najraniji je od sačuvanih portreta koje je izradio veliki španjolski slikar i kipar grčkog podrijetla El Greco.	0.531724
It was painted as a token of thanks for the help and recommendations Klović gave the then young, unknown painter.	Nastao je kao znak zahvalnosti za pomoć i Klovićeve preporuke tada još mladomu i nepoznatomu slikaru.	0.28
		0.3
Did you know?	Jeste li znali?	0.25
Janica Kostelić, the Croatian skier who won four gold and two silver Olympic medals, is the best Alpine woman skier in the history of the Winter Olympic Games.	S osvojene četiri zlatne i dvije srebrne olimpijske medalje hrvatska skijašica Janica Kostelić najbolja je alpska skijašica u povijesti Zimskih olimpijskih igara.	0.403569

Fairy tale Croatia	Fairy tale Croatia	2.55
Croatia has more than a thousand islands and islets, and its Adriatic shoreline is the third longest in Mediterranean.	Hrvatska ima više od tisuću otoka i otočića i treću najdužu obalu na Sredozemlju.	0.196
Coats of arms of the Triune Kingdom of Croatia, Dalmatia and Slavonia and of the City of Zagreb on the roof of coloured tiles of the St. Mark’s church in Zagreb.	Grbovi Trojedne Kraljevine Hrvatske, Slavonije i Dalmacije te grada Zagreba na krovu crkve sv. ~~~ Marka u Zagrebu.	-0.055102
The Sabor is one of the oldest diets in Europe.	Hrvatski sabor jedan je od najstarijih parlamenata u Europi.	0.192308
Life expectancy in Croatia is 80 years for women and 73 years for men.	U Hrvatskoj očekivana životna dob iznosi 80 godina za žene i 73 godine za muškarce.	2.61724
Croatia Airlines, the national airline, founded in 1989, is a member of Star Alliance since 2004.	Croatia Airlines, hrvatska nacionalna zrakoplovna kompanija osnovana 1989, član je udruženja Star Alliance od 2004.	1.3491
Nikola Tesla (1856-1943), a pioneer of modern alternating current electricity supply system.	Nikola Tesla, pionir modernog sustava prijenosa električne energije izmjeničnom strujom.	0.572727
His name was given to the tesla unit of magnetic induction.	Jedinica magnetske indukcije nosi njegovo ime.	0.242857

Klapa multipart a capella singing of Dalmatia has been inscribed on the List of Intangible World Heritage.	Višeglasno pjevanje dalmatinskih klapa upisano je na UNESCO-ovu listu nematerijalne svjetske baštine.	0.293407
Croatia is the homeland of the cravat.	Hrvatska je domovina kravate.	0.233333
The largest tie in the world was installed in 2003 around the Roman amphitheatre in Pula by Marijan Bušić.	Najveća kravata na svijetu instalirana je 2003. oko rimskog amfiteatra u Puli (autor: Marijan Bušić).	0.4875
		0.3
Croatia is shaped like a horseshoe, stretching from Vukovar in the northeast, past Zagreb in the west, and to Dubrovnik in the far south.	Hrvatska ima oblik potkove koja se proteže od Vukovara na sjeveroistoku preko Zagreba na zapadu do Dubrovnika na krajnjem jugu.	0.286364
It gained most of its present-day contours at the end of the 17th century. ~~~ With a surface area of 56,594 km², it is 19th among the European Union countries according to size, falling between Latvia and Slovakia.	Te je obrise najvećim dijelom dobila još potkraj 17. st. S kopnenom površinom od 56 594 km² 19. je po veličini zemlja Europske unije, između Latvije i Slovačke.	-0.0349138
In terms of relief and climate, it is extremely diverse.	Reljefno i klimatski iznimno je raznolika zemlja.	0.272727
The territory includes extensive plains in the continental region between the River Drava and River Sava (Slavonia), mountainous areas in the centre (Lika and Gorski Kotar), and in the west and south, a long, indented, sunny coastline with over a thousand islands (Istria and Dalmatia).	Njezino područje istodobno obuhvaća prostrane nizine u kontinentalnom dijelu između rijeka Drave i Save (Slavonija), prave planinske krajeve u središnjem (Lika i Gorski kotar), a u zapadnom i južnom dijelu dugačku, razvedenu i osunčanu obalu s više od 1000 otoka (Istra i Dalmacija).	0.427722
Croatia belongs to the Danube Basin and the Adriatic Sea and forms the Mediterranean front of Central Europe, positioned favourably in terms of geography and communications at the meeting point of important European corridors, while its harbours are used as sea exits by the neighbouring countries to the north.		-0.3
Croatia is the third richest country in Europe in terms of natural water resources, and boasts a particularly well-preserved ecological environment, with hundreds of endemic plant and animal species.	Kao podunavska i jadranska zemlja te mediteransko pročelje Srednje Europe, ima povoljan geoprometni položaj na susretištu važnih europskih koridora, a njezine su luke izlaz na more za sjevernije susjedne zemlje.	0.273837
Almost 10% of the country is protected within 11 nature parks, 8 national parks and two strict nature reserves.	Osim što je treća u Europi po vodnom bogatstvu, Hrvatska ima osobito očuvanu prirodu sa stotinama endemskih biljnih i životinjskih vrsta, te je gotovo 10% njezina teritorija zaštićeno u okviru 11 parkova prirode, 8 nacionalnih parkova i dva stroga rezervata.	1.82872
		0.3
Contemporary Croatia, which gained independence in 1991, is the successor of the 9th century Croatian medieval prinicipalities established in the marches of the Carolingian Empire, followed by the Kingdom of Croatia, founded in 925 by King Tomislav.	Suvremena Hrvatska, neovisna od 1991, nasljednica je hrvatskih srednjovjekovnih kneževina iz 9. st., uspostavljenih na markama Karolinškog Carstva, potom i Hrvatskoga Kraljevstva, utemeljena 925. za kralja Tomislava.	0.3745
Soon after the death of the last great Croatian king, Dmitar Zvonimir, Croatia entered into a personal union with Hungary, and in the 14th century, the throne belonged to the French Anjou dynasty.	Nedugo nakon smrti posljednjega velikog hrvatskog kralja Dmitra Zvonimira Hrvatska je 1102. sklopila personalnu uniju s Ugarskom, čije je prijestolje u 14. st. pripalo francuskoj Anžuvinskoj dinastiji.	0.276364
After the Ottoman invasions in the 16th century and the loss of large tracts of land, Croatian dignitaries elected Ferdinand Habsburg as monarch in 1527, and the country remained within the Austrian Empire until 1918.	Nakon prodora Osmanlija u 16. st. i gubitka velikih dijelova zemlje, hrvatski velikaši izabiru 1527. ~~~ Ferdinanda I. Habsburgovca za vladara, čime Hrvatska sve do 1918. biva dijelom Austrijskog Carstva.	-0.0059322
The first half of this period was marked by constant wars with the Ottomans and Venetian encroachment upon greater and greater areas along the coast (Istria and Dalmatia), apart from the far south, where the independent Dubrovnik Republic developed free trade in the Mediterranean between 1358 and 1808.	Prva polovica toga razdoblja obilježena je neprestanim ratovima s Osmanlijama i venecijanskim prisvajanjem sve većega dijela obale (Istre i Dalmacije), osim na krajnjem jugu, gdje se Dubrovnik 1358–1808.	0.277481
After the defeat of Venice and a short period in which southern Croatia was incorporated in Napoleon’s province of Illyria (1809–1813), all the Croatian lands were brought together within the Habsburg Monarchy, though they were still separate entities.	razvija kao neovisna republika i slobodno trguje po Sredozemlju. ~~~ Nakon poraza Venecije i kratkotrajnog uključivanja južnog dijela Hrvatske u Napoleonove Ilirske pokrajine (1809–13) sve su se hrvatske zemlje našle u sklopu Habsburške Monarhije, ali i dalje razdvojene.	-0.0136364
They were united briefly in 1848, during the Croatian national revival.	Nakratko su ujedinjene 1848, za hrvatskoga narodnoga preporoda.	0.607018
After the First World War, Croatia became part of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia, which was transformed after 1945 into a Communist federation, in which Croatia was one of six republics until 1991.	Nakon Prvoga svjetskog rata Hrvatska postaje dio Kraljevine Jugoslavije, preoblikovane nakon 1945. u komunističku federaciju, u kojoj je do 1991. jedna od šest republika.	0.396
Although recognised as an independent state by the international community on 15 January 1992, Croatia was forced to defend its independence by armed struggle until 1995, when the occupied territories were liberated.	No iako je kao samostalna država međunarodno priznata 15. siječnja 1992, Hrvatska je bila prisiljena oružjem braniti svoju neovisnost sve do 1995. i oslobađanja okupiranih područja.	0.36878
In 1992, Croatia became a member of the United Nations, in 2009, of NATO, and on 1 July 2013, of the European Union.	Godine 1992. postala je članicom UN-a, 2009. ~~~ NATO-a, a 1. srpnja 2013. ~~~ Europske unije.	-0.150794
		0.3
Croatia is a parliamentary democracy and is organised as a unitary republic.	Hrvatska je parlamentarna demokracija, a po svom ustroju jedinstvena republika.	0.277273
The social state, freedom, equality, equal rights and the rule of law are among the highest values of the constitutional order.	Također je socijalna država, a sloboda, jednakost, ravnopravnost i vladavina prava među najvišim su vrednotama ustavnoga poretka.	0.272222
The political system is based on the principle of the division of power into three branches: the legislative, the executive and the judiciary.	Politički sustav utemeljen je na načelu trodiobe vlasti na zakonodavnu, izvršnu i sudsku.	0.151852
In the Croatian parliament, or Sabor, which has a single house and has inherited many centuries of parliamentary tradition, its members are elected for four years.	U jednodomni parlament, Sabor, koji baštini višestoljetnu parlamentarnu tradiciju, zastupnici se biraju na četiri godine.	0.411824
The President of the Republic, who is elected by general, direct election for a period of five years, represents the country abroad, cooperates with the Government in shaping and implementing foreign policy and commands the armed forces.	Predsjednik Republike, koji se bira na općim i neposrednim izborima na pet godina, zastupa zemlju u inozemstvu, surađuje s Vladom u oblikovanju i provođenju vanjske politike i zapovijeda oružanim snagama.	0.263333
The Government proposes laws and the State Budget, leads foreign and internal policy, and directs and monitors the work of the state administration.	Vlada predlaže zakone i državni proračun, vodi vanjsku i unutarnju politiku te usmjerava i nadzire rad državne uprave.	0.240566
Croatia is divided administratively into 20 counties and the City of Zagreb.	Hrvatska je administrativno podijeljena na 20 županija i Grad Zagreb.	3.55337
Alongside the judiciary, the institute of the Ombudsperson promotes and protects the legal rights of citizens. ~~~ There are also Ombudspersons for Children, Gender Equality, and Persons with Disabilities.	Uz sudbenu vlast postoje i instituti Pučkoga pravobranitelja, koji promiče i štiti ustavna i zakonska prava građana, te pravobranitelja za djecu, ravnopravnost spolova i osobe s invaliditetom.	-0.00526316
		0.3
With a population of 4.3 million, Croatia ranks 21st in the European Union, between Ireland and Lithuania.	S 4,3 milijuna stanovnika Hrvatska je 21. zemlja Europske unije, između Irske i Litve.	0.236
About 60% of the population live in urban centres occupying less than 15% of the territory of the country, and of these, one in four lives in the capital, Zagreb.	Oko 60% stanovništva živi u urbanim sredinama, koje čine manje od 15% površine zemlje, a od toga svaki četvrti stanovnik živi u glavnom gradu Zagrebu.	0.528514
As life expectancy has risen, almost a quarter of the population of Croatia is over 60 years of age, while about 15% is under 15.	Produljenjem očekivane životne dobi stanovništvo gotovo četvrtina stanovnika Hrvatske starije je od 60 godina, a oko 15% mlađe je od 15 godina.	0.498605
In terms of nationality, Croats comprise 90% of the population.	Prema narodnosnomu sastavu Hrvati čine više od 90% stanovništva.	0.572727
The Roman Catholic Church is the largest religious confession (86%), followed by the Orthodox (4.4%; mostly Serbs, who also form the largest national minority), Muslims (1.5%) and Protestants (0.3%).	S udjelom od 86% u kategoriji vjeroispovijesti najzastupljeniji su rimokatolici, pravoslavaca je 4,4%, uglavnom Srba, koji su i najbrojnija nacionalna manjina, muslimana 1,5%, a protestanata 0,3%.	0.3
Croats also live in neighbouring countries as indigenous inhabitants, mostly in Bosnia and Herzegovina.	Hrvati kao autohtono stanovništvo žive i u susjednim zemljama, ponajviše u Bosni i Hercegovini.	0.282558
The Croatian diaspora worldwide, from Australia to North and South America and Western Europe, comprises over two and a half million people.	Hrvatska dijaspora u svijetu, od Australije do Sjeverne i Južne Amerike te Zapadne Europe, obuhvaća više od dva i pol milijuna ljudi.	0.42009
		0.3
Since service industries comprise about two-thirds of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and agriculture accounts for less than 5%, the structure of the Croatian economy is similar to that of the countries of the European Union.	Budući da uslužne djelatnosti čine oko dvije trećine bruto domaćega proizvoda (BDP), a udio je poljoprivrede manji od 5%, hrvatsko gospodarstvo po svojoj je strukturi slično gospodarstvima zemalja Europske unije.	0.395187
The main economic branches in the country are determined by natural resources, but also by technology and industry (shipbuilding, construction, petrochemicals, the food industry).	Glavne gospodarske grane u zemlji određene su prirodnim bogatstvima, ali i tehnologijom i industrijom (brodogradnja, graditeljstvo, petrokemija, prehrambena industrija).	0.292157
The most important branch of the economy is tourism, with 10 million foreign guests per year, contributing 15% to GDP.	Najvažnija je gospodarska grana turizam, s 10 milijuna stranih gostiju godišnje te i 15% udjela u BDP-u.	2.27033
As in many European countries, the greatest problem facing the Croatian economy in the current period of crisis is the relatively high level of unemployment.	Kao i u mnogim europskim zemljama u doba krize najveći je problem hrvatskoga gospodarstva relativno visoka stopa nezaposlenosti.	0.402143
Croatia has a developed infrastructure, and in the last 15 years, 1,000 km of modern highways have been built, which has contributed significantly to linking the countries of the European Union.	Hrvatska ima razvijenu infrastrukturu, a u posljednjih je petnaest godina izgradila čak 1000 km modernih autocesta, čime je znatno pridonijela i povezanosti zemalja Unije.	0.392185
In fact, Croatia conducts almost two-thirds of foreign trade with these countries, primarily Italy, Germany, Slovenia and Austria, while Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia are also important trading partners.	Upravo s njima, ponajprije s Italijom, Njemačkom, Slovenijom i Austrijom, Hrvatska ostvaruje gotovo dvije trećine svoje vanjske trgovine, a važni su joj trgovinski partneri i Bosna i Hercegovina te Srbija.	0.3
		0.3
In alignment with European standards, Croatia’s higher education system has adopted the best features of the Bologna Process, contributing to the growing integration of science and scientists in Europe.	U skladu s europskim standardima hrvatsko je visoko školstvo na svojim učilištima prihvatilo najbolje odlike Bolonjskoga procesa, pridonoseći rastućoj integraciji znanosti i znanstvenika u Europi.	0.298305
The modern Croatian education and science system is based on a tradition founded in 1396, when the first public university opened in Zadar. ~~~ The University of Zagreb, which is today the largest, dates back to 1669.	Suvremeni hrvatski obrazovni i znanstveni sustavi zasnivaju se na tradiciji utemeljenoj još 1396, kad je u Zadru osnovano prvo sveučilište, a najveće, zagrebačko, datira iz 1669.	0.0417453
Among Croatian scientists and inventors, many have made particular contributions to international knowledge, especially Ruđer Bošković (1711–87) and Nikola Tesla (1856–1943).	Među brojnim hrvatskim znanstvenicima i izumiteljima međunarodnoj su znanosti osobito pridonijeli Ruđer Bošković (1711–87) i Nikola Tesla (1856–1943).	1.20751
The former was a Jesuit mathematician, astronomer, philosopher, diplomat and poet, came to prominence by producing an atomic theory and was one of the most renowned physicists of his day.	Prvi od njih, isusovac, matematičar, astronom, filozof, diplomat i pjesnik, istaknuo se teorijom atomistike kao jedan od najuglednijih fizičara, a po njem je nazvan i krater na Mjesecu.	0.399675
One of the craters on the Moon is named after him. ~~~ The modern system of transmitting electrical energy would have been unthinkable without the inventor Nikola Tesla, who created the first hydroelectric plant on the Niagara Falls, and invented the electric motor which we find today in almost all household appliances.	Današnji je pak sustav prijenosa električne energije nezamisliv bez izumitelja Nikole Tesle, tvorca prve hidroelektrane, na slapovima Niagare, i električnoga motora kakav se nalazi u gotovo svim kućanskim aparatima.	-0.028125
Other inventions which are now part of daily life, such as the tie, the parachute, the solid-ink fountain pen, the airship, the MP3 player and fingerprint identification techniques, are numbered among the products of Croatian creative minds.	I na drugim izumima koji su čine svakidašnjicu modernoga čovjeka, primjerice na kravati, padobranu, penkali, cepelinu, mp3-playeru ili sustavu identifikacije otiskom prsta, razabire se potpis hrvatske stvaralačke misli.	0.286294
Scientific excellence is best recognised through the Nobel Prize, and two Croatian chemists, Lavoslav Ružička (1939) and Vladimir Prelog (1975), have been awarded it.	Takva znanstvena izvrsnost svoj najviši izraz ima u Nobelovoj nagradi, koju su dobila dvojica hrvatskih kemičara, Lavoslav Ružička (1939) i Vladimir Prelog (1975).	0.925
		0.3
Always part of central European and Mediterranean cultural circles, or to be more precise, the meeting-point of Western civilisation and the East, the richness of Croatian culture testifies today to the links Croats have had with key European cultural epochs.	Oduvijek dio srednjoeuropskih i mediteranskih kulturnih krugova, točnije zapadne civilizacije na susretištu s istokom, hrvatsko kulturno bogatstvo i danas svjedoči o povezanosti Hrvatske s ključnim europskim kulturnim epohama.	0.275
Among the visible traces of this are six monuments in the UNESCO World Heritage List: the untouched land division (parcelisation) of an Ancient Greek field in Stari Grad on Hvar, the Classical heart of Split with the palace of the Roman emperor Diocletian, the early Christian Euphrasian Basilica in Poreč, the Romanesque centre of the town of Trogir, the early Renaissance Cathedral of St. James in Šibenik, and Renaissance Dubrovnik.	Među vidljivijim su tragovima toga bogatstva šest spomenika na UNESCO-ovu popisu svjetske kulturne baštine: netaknuta parcelizacija starogrčkog polja u Starom Gradu na Hvaru, gradska jezgra antičkog Splita s palačom rimskog cara Dioklecijana, ranokršćanska Eufrazijeva bazilika, romanička jezgra grada Trogira, ranorenesansna katedrala sv. ~~~ Jakova u Šibeniku te renesansni Dubrovnik.	-0.00905172
Among great artists and writers, Marko Marulić (1450–1524), the “father of Croatian literature”, whose works were read throughout Europe, deserves special mention. ~~~ Juraj Dalmatinac (15th century) was the greatest Croatian Renaissance sculptor and architect, Julije Klović (1498–1578) the greatest Renaissance miniaturist, Luka Sorkočević (1734–89) the first Croatia composer of a symphony, Ivana Brlić-Mažuranić (1874–1938) the “Croatian Andersen”, Ivan Meštrović (1883–1962) the most famous sculptor, and according to Rodin “the greatest phenomenon among artists”, Milka Trnina (1863–1941) the greatest opera diva, and Miroslav Krleža (1893–1981), an encyclopaedist, was in many ways the greatest Croatian writer of the 20th century.	Od najvećih umjetnika i književnika valja spomenuti Marka Marulića (1450–1524), »oca hrvatske književnosti«, čija su se djela čitala diljem Europe, Jurja Dalmatinca (15. st.), najvećega hrvatskog renesansnog kipara i graditelja, Julija Klovića (1498–1578), najvećeg renesansnog minijaturista, Luku Sorkočevića (1734–89), prvoga hrvatskoga skladatelja simfonija, Ivanu Brlić-Mažuranić (1874–1938), »hrvatskoga Andersena«, Ivana Meštrovića (1883–1962), slavnoga kipara i, prema Rodinu, »najvećeg fenomena među umjetnicima«, Milku Trninu (1863–1941), najveću hrvatsku opernu divu, ili pak Miroslava Krležu (1893–1981), enciklopedista i po mnogima najvećega hrvatskoga pisca 20. stoljeća.	0.0517182
Among modern artists, Branko Lustig (1932), the producer of the Oscar-winning films Schindler’s List and Gladiator, the piano virtuoso Ivo Pogorelić and the duet 2Cellos are prominent.	Među suvremenim umjetnicima ističu se Branko Lustig (1932), producent Oscarom nagrađenih filmova Schindlerova lista i Gladijator, pijanistički virtuoz Ivo Pogorelić te violončelistički duet 2Cellos.	0.981111
		0.3
The traditional way of life in Croatia is characterised primarily by community, which is reflected in customs, crafts and folklore, and also in eating habits, with regional cuisines becoming more and more available to foreign guests as part of the tourist range of services.	Tradicionalni način života obilježen je ponajprije zajedništvom, koje se ogleda u običajima, obrtima i folkloru, ali i u gastronomskim navikama, obilježenima ponajprije regionalnim osobitostima, koje su kao dio turističke ponude sve dostupnije i inozemnim gostima.	0.292241
Croatia is particularly proud of its top quality olive oil and selected indigenous wines.	Hrvatska se osobito ponosi vrhunskim maslinovim uljem i biranim autohtonim sortama vina.	0.296104
The community spirit is also seen in sports and recreation – popular ways of spending leisure time.	Spomenuto zajedništvo očituje se i u sportu i rekreaciji – popularnim načinima provođenja slobodnoga vremena.	0.431686
In this sense, and due to the success of top sportsmen and women, Croatia is considered to be one of the top sporting countries of Europe.	S obzirom na to, ali i uspjehe svojih vrhunskih sportaša, Hrvatska se drži jednom od najsportskijih europskih zemalja.	0.271154
Our sportspeople have often been high profile representatives of the country; among them are the basketball player Dražen Petrović, the footballer Davor Šuker, the tennis player Goran Ivanišević, the skiers Janica and Ivica Kostelić, and the national waterpolo and handball teams.	Upravo su sportaši nerijetko bili prepoznatljivi predstavnici zemlje, a među njima se ističu košarkaš Dražen Petrović, nogometaš Davor Šuker, tenisač Goran Ivanišević, skijaši Janica i Ivica Kostelić, ali i reprezentacije u vaterpolu i rukometu.	1.045
		0.3
Bearing in mind the specific features and influences which were interwoven in it, being as it is on the border between Eastern and Western civilizations, the root and expression of Croatian culture has always been unambiguously European.	Imajući na umu sve njezine posebnosti i utjecaje koji su se kroz nju prepletali, kao razmeđu istočne i zapadne civilizacije, korijen je i izraz hrvatske kulture uvijek bio nedvosmisleno zapadnoeuropski.	0.257627
Cultural relations of Croatia and Croats with other European nations and countries have a long tradition, dating back to the founding of the first Croatian duchies (9th century).	Kulturni odnosi Hrvatske i Hrvata s drugim europskim narodima i zemljama imaju dugu tradiciju, već od uspostavljanja prvih hrvatskih kneževina (9. st.).	0.259701
Those relations were multiplied with the later development of specific national cultures, and are today, especially in the framework of modern globalization processes, being fitted into worldwide culture, however retaining their recognizable identity.	Kasnijim razvojem pojedinih narodnih kultura oni se i umnažaju, te se danas, poglavito u okviru suvremenih globalizacijskih procesa, uklapaju i u svjetsku kulturu, no zadržavajući svoj prepoznatljiv identitet.	0.245161
Within today's European Union, several cultural circles can be identified – Central European, German, Italian, French and British – with which Croatia has had rewarding contacts through its history.	U okrilju današnje Europske unije nalazi se nekoliko kulturnih krugova – srednjoeuropski, njemački, talijanski, francuski i britanski – s kojima je Hrvatska kroz povijest imala najbogatije doticaje.	0.507429
		0.3
It is impossible to provide an entire “cycle of knowledge” about Croatia, but it is worth mentioning that the concept describing such knowledge – the encyclopaedia – found its place in the title of a work by Croatian humanist Pavao Skalić as early as in 1559, from where it spread to all languages of the world.	Potpuno »zaokruženo znanje« o Hrvatskoj nije moguće napisati, no vrijedi spomenuti da se pojam kojim se takvo znanje označuje – enciklopedija – već 1559. našao u naslovu jednoga djela hrvatskog humanista Pavla Skalića, odakle se proširio u sve jezike svijeta.	0.405316
In a similar fashion, the neck tie (cravat), which first appeared as part of the Croatian military uniform in the form of a picturesque adornment around the necks of Croatian soldiers in the Thirty Years War, was also accepted as a mark of elegance throughout the world.	Slično se svijetom, kao mjera elegancije, raširila i kravata, koje su prvi primjerci bili slikoviti rupci na odori hrvatskih vojnika u Tridesetogodišnjem ratu.	0.121277
Thanks to the Croatian computer programmer Tomislav Uzelac, MP3 Players have become an essential part of our everyday life.	Nezaobilazni su dio svakidašnjice, zaslugom hrvatskoga programera Tomislava Uzelca, i MP3-svirači.	0.250549
Venetian explorer Marko Polo was born too early to possess such a player, but, according to some researchers, he is connected to Croatia by his family’s place of origin – the island of Korčula.	Venecijanski istraživač Marko Polo rodio se prerano da bi imao takav svirač, no s Hrvatskom ga, prema nekim istraživačima, povezuje mjesto obiteljskoga podrijetla – otok Korčula.	0.737037
The Dalmatian dog, the best known indigenous Croatian canine breed, without which the famous Disney cartoon 101 Dalmatians would never have been made, also originates from the same part of Croatia.	Iz toga dijela Hrvatske potječe i dalmatinski pas, najpoznatija autohtona hrvatska pseća pasmina, bez koje ne bi bilo glasovitoga Disneyeva animiranog filma 101 dalmatinac.	1.58842
In this chapter, you will find out many more interesting facts about Croatia...	U ovom poglavlju otkrit ćete još mnoge zanimljivosti o Hrvatskoj...	0.265574
The Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts is the oldest in Southeast Europe (1866) and has up to 160 full members (academicians) in its 9 departments.	Hrvatska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti (HAZU), najstarija u jugoistočnoj Europi (1866), u 9 svojih razreda okuplja do 160 redovitih članova (akademika).	1.91017
It also encompasses several scientific-research and art institutes, as well as numerous scientific boards and councils.	U svom sastavu HAZU ima i znanstvenoistraživačke i umjetničke institute te mnoga znanstvena vijeća i odbore.	0.278571
		0.3
Scientific activities in Croatia are carried out in universities and their component departments, by the scientific institutes, as well as by the Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts.	Znanstvenu djelatnost u Hrvatskoj, osim sveučilišta i njihovih sastavnica obavljaju znanstveni instituti i Hrvatska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti.	0.246269
In 2010, over 11,000 scientists and researchers were employed in 234 scientific and research institutions; in that year, they published 10,014 scientific and research papers.	U 2010. više od 11 000 znanstvenika i istraživača bilo je zaposleno u 234 znanstvene i istraživačke institucije; oni su te godine objavili 10 014 znanstvenih i istraživačkih radova.	1.54142
The largest science and art institution is the Croatian Academy of Sciences and Arts (HAZU), founded in Zagreb in 1866, thanks to the efforts of the Bishop of Đakovo, Josip Juraj Strossmayer (1815–1905). ~~~ It was called the Yugoslav Academy of Sciences and Arts (JAZU).	Najviša je znanstvena i umjetnička ustanova Hrvatska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti (HAZU), osnovana u Zagrebu 1866. zalaganjem đakovačkoga biskupa Josipa Jurja Strossmayera (1815–1905) pod imenom Jugoslavenska akademija znanosti i umjetnosti (JAZU).	0.0455592
Its main task was to encourage and organise Croatian scientists, artists and those engaged in cultural activities and to promote their work abroad.	Glavna joj je zadaća poticanje i organiziranje hrvatske znanstvene, umjetničke i kulturne djelatnosti te njihovo promicanje u svijetu.	0.285
The Academy is divided into nine departments, and several scientific institutes.	Akademija ima 9 razreda i više znanstvenih instituta.	0.15625
It also operates a library, the Strossmayer Gallery of Old Masters, a Glyptotheque, a Graphics Office and Archives.	U njezinu je sastavu knjižnica, Strossmayerova galerija starih majstora, Gliptoteka, Kabinet grafike i Arhiv.	0.296939
		0.3
The largest scientific and research institution in Croatia is the Ruđer Bošković Institute, founded in 1950, which operates in the area of research in the natural sciences.	Najveća je znanstveno-istraživačka ustanova u Hrvatskoj Institut Ruđer Bošković, osnovan 1950, a djeluje na području prirodoznanstvenih istraživanja.	0.616432
Among other notable institutes are the Croatian Engineering Institute, the Ivo Pilar Institute of Social Sciences, the Institute for Ethnology and Folklore, the Institute of Physics of the University of Zagreb, the Institute for Croatian Language and Philology, the Croatian Institute for History, the Institute for Medical Research and Occupational Health, the Economics Institute, the Institute for Art History, the Institute for Oceanography and Fisheries in Split, the Agricultural Institute in Osijek, etc.	Među značajnije institute ubrajaju se i Institut građevinarstva Hrvatske, Institut društvenih znanosti Ivo Pilar, Institut za etnologiju i folkloristiku, Institut za fiziku Sveučilišta u Zagrebu, Institut za hrvatski jezik i jezikoslovlje, Hrvatski institut za povijest, Institut za medicinska istraživanja i medicinu rada, Ekonomski institut, Institut za povijest umjetnosti, Institut za oceanografiju i ribarstvo u Splitu, Poljoprivredni institut u Osijeku i dr. ~~~ 	0.0139994
Scientists	Znanstvenici	0.245455
		0.3
The first major contribution to Western European scholarship was made by Herman Dalmatin in the 12th century. ~~~ In the 14th and 15th centuries, Croatian scientists worked in European centres.	Prvi veliki doprinos zapadnoeuropskoj znanosti dao je Herman Dalmatin u 12. st. U 14. i 15. st. hrvatski znanstvenici djeluju u europskim središtima.	0.110816
In the 16th century the Zadar doctor and physicist Frederik Grisogono produced a valuable theory on tides and promoted astrological medicine.	U 16. st. zadarski je liječnik i fizičar Frederik Grisogono dao vrijednu teoriju plime i oseke te promicao astrološku medicinu.	0.558929
In the same century, the astronomers and natural philosophers Nikola Nalješković, Nikola Vitov Gučetić, Miho Monaldi and Antun Medo were working in Dubrovnik, while the foremost Croatian philosopher and scientist was Frane Petrić.	U tom su stoljeću u Dubrovniku djelovali i astronomi i prirodni filozofi Nikola Nalješković, Nikola Vitov Gučetić, Miho Monaldi i Antun Medo, a najpoznatiji hrvatski filozof i znanstvenik bio je Frane Petrić.	1.17648
In the 17th century, the theologian and scientist Markantun de Dominis from Rab wrote on optics and the tides. ~~~ Marin Getaldić contributed to world mathematics, and the inventor Faust Vrančić made the first parachute.	U 17. st. teolog i znanstvenik Markantun de Dominis iz Raba piše o optici, plimi i oseci, Marin Getaldić daje prilog svjetskoj matematici, a izumitelj Faust Vrančić konstruira prvi padobran.	0.262895
The central figure of the 18th century was Ruđer Bošković, with his natural philosophy.	Središnja ličnost hrvatske znanosti u 18. st. bio je Ruđer Bošković sa svojom prirodnom filozofijom.	0.446154
In the 19th century, several scientists worked in Hungary and Slovakia, among them the astronomer and mathematician Mirko Danijel Bogdanić and the physicist Franjo Josip Domin.	U 19. st. više znanstvenika djeluje u Ugarskoj i Slovačkoj, među njima astronom i matematičar Mirko Danijel Bogdanić i fizičar Franjo Josip Domin.	0.999618
In the early 20th century, the geophysicist Andrija Mohorovičić made a great contribution to world science, as did the palaeontologist Dragutin Gorjanović-Kramberger, whose interpretation of his findings concerning prehistoric people in Krapina placed him among the founders of world palaeoanthropology.	Početkom 20. st. velik doprinos svjetskoj znanosti dali su geofizičar Andrija Mohorovičić te paleontolog Dragutin Gorjanović-Kramberger, koji se tumačenjem nalaza krapinskog pračovjeka svrstao u utemeljitelje svjetske paleoatropologije.	0.659764
In that period, the unique figure of Nikola Tesla stood out as an inventor and scientist.	U tom razdoblju ističe se osebujna ličnost izumitelja i znanstvenika Nikole Tesle.	0.295946
During the 20th century, eminent scientists were at work in Croatia and abroad, for example the physicist Ivan Supek, and the Nobel prize winners Ružička and Prelog, and the tradition is continued today by Miroslav Radman and Ivan Đikić (chemistry), Davor Pavuna and Marin Soljačić (physics) and many others.	Tijekom 20. st. eminentni znanstvenici djeluju u Hrvatskoj i u inozemstvu, npr. ~~~ fizičar Ivan Supek, nobelovci Ružička i Prelog, a tu tradiciju danas nastavljaju molekularni biolozi Miroslav Radman i Ivan Đikić, fizičari Davor Pavuna i Marin Soljačić te brojni drugi.	0.480573
		0.3
Herman Dalmatin (c.1110–43), philosopher, theologian, astronomer and translator.	Herman Dalmatin (oko 1110 – nakon 1143), filozof, teolog, astronom i prevoditelj.	0.954338
He translated Arabic astronomy and astrology texts into Latin, and was the first person to begin translating the Qur’an.	S arapskog prevodio astronomske i astrološke tekstove na latinski te prvi započeo prijevod Kurana.	0.242045
He translated Ptolemy’s Planisphaerium and revised a translation of Euclid’s Elements.	Preveo Ptolomejevo djelo Planisphera te revidirao prijevod Euklidovih Elemenata.	0.267123
His major work was De essentiis, in which he set forth his own philosophical system.	Glavno mu je djelo O bitima, u kojem je razložio vlastiti filozofski sustav.	0.277273
Benedict Kotruljević (c.1416–69), diplomat and writer; moved to Naples in 1453.	Benedikt Kotruljević (oko 1416–69), diplomat i pisac; 1453. preselio se u Napulj.	1.04589
He was the author of the first systematic European work on trade (On Trade and the Perfect Trader), and the first to write about double-entry bookkeeping.	Autor je prvoga sustavnog europskog djela o trgovini (O trgovini i savršenom trgovcu); prvi pisao o dvostavnom knjigovodstvu.	0.245455
Frane Petrić (Franciscus Patricius) (1529–97), philosopher and polymath. ~~~ He worked in Modena, Ferrara and Rome, where he taught philosophy as a Neo-Platonist and as an opponent of Aristotelianism. ~~~ He had a significant influence on the emergence of new Western European branches of science and philosophy.	Frane Petrić (Franciscus Patricius) (1529–97), filozof i polihistor; djelovao u Modeni, Ferrari i Rimu, gdje je predavao filozofiju; antiaristotelovac i novoplatonist, bitno utjecao na pojavu nove zapadnoeuropske znanosti i filozofije.	0.251208
In his works, he dealt with other branches of knowledge (geometry and the history of war).	U djelima je obrađivao i druga područja znanja (geometrija, povijest ratovanja).	0.287671
		0.3
Ruđer Josip Bošković (1711–87), physicist, mathematician, astronomer and philosopher.	Ruđer Josip Bošković (1711–87), fizičar, matematičar, astronom i filozof.	1.4589
He was a Jesuit, professor of mathematics in Rome, Pavia and Milan, and Director of Optics for the French Navy in Paris.	Bio je isusovac, profesor matematike u Rimu, Paviji i Milanu te upravitelj optike za francusku ratnu mornaricu u Parizu.	0.291
He was a member of the Royal Society in London.	Član londonskoga Royal Society.	0.81
His major work was the Theory of Natural Philosophy, in which he constructed an original theory about forces and the structure of materials, which has received many affirmations through the discoveries of modern science.	Glavnim djelom Teorija prirodne filozofije izgradio je izvornu teoriju sila i strukture tvari, koja dobiva sve više potvrda u spoznajama moderne fizike.	0.17594
He published many works describing original discoveries in the fields of mathematics, astronomy, geophysics and archaeology, and made many different optical, astronomical and geodetic instruments. ~~~ He carried out expert projects in hydro-technology, geodesy, cartography, statics and measuring (he fixed the cupola of St. Peter’s Basilica in Rome and the Cathedral in Milan).	Objavio je mnogobrojne radove s izvornim otkrićima iz područja matematike, astronomije, geofizike, arheologije; izradio je različite optičke, astronomske i geodetske instrumente; proveo je hidrotehničke, geodetske, kartografske i statičke ekspertize i mjerenja (učvrstio kupole bazilike sv. ~~~ Petra u Rimu i katedrale u Milanu).	-0.186364
		0.3
Andrija Mohorovičić (1857–1936), geophysicist.	Andrija Mohorovičić (1857–1936), geofizičar; od 1892. bio upravitelj meteorološkog opservatorija u Zagrebu.	1.75625
From 1892 he was the Director of the Meteorological Observatory in Zagreb.	Bavio se meteorologijom i seizmologijom, uveo je službu točnog vremena.	0.295313
	Njegov doprinos svjetskoj znanosti otkriće je sloja u Zemljinoj kori (Mohorovičićev diskontinuitet ili Moho), u kojem dolazi do porasta brzine širenja potresnih valova.	-0.3
He worked in meteorology and seismology and introduced the exact time service.	Njegovo otkriće omogućilo je precizno lociranje epicentra potresa.	0.270968
His contribution to world science was his discovery in the Earth’s core of the Mohorovičić discontinuity (Moho), which leads to an acceleration in the spread of shock waves.	Lavoslav Ružička (1887–1976), kemičar; od 1912. profesor i predstojnik Laboratorija za organsku kemiju na visokoj školi u Zürichu.	0.22562
His discovery enabled the epicentres of earthquakes to be located precisely.	Istaknuo se mnogobrojnim organskim sintezama i radom na steroidima i spolnim hormonima.	0.255224
