After an agreement between all Croatian parliamentary parties on accession to the EU was reached, the application for membership was submitted on 21 February 2003.	2005). ~~~ Nakon što je postignut dogovor svih hrvatskih parlamentarnih stranaka o pristupanju Europskoj uniji, zahtjev za članstvo podnesen je 21. ~~~ II.	-0.108527
The continuity of integrated efforts was maintained after a change in government.	2003. godine. ~~~ Kontinuitet integracijskih nastojanja održan je i nakon smjene vlasti.	-0.0147887
In 2003 and 2007, HDZ again won parliamentary elections, and the prime ministers from their ranks were Ivo Sanader (2003–09) and Jadranka Kosor (2009–11).	HDZ je ponovno pobijedio na parlamentarnim izborima 2003. i 2007; premijeri iz njegovih redova bili su Ivo Sanader (2003–09) i Jadranka Kosor (2009–11).	1.17278
Ivo Josipović, the SDP candidate, won the presidential election in 2010.	Na predsjedničkim izborima 2010. pobijedio je Ivo Josipović (kandidat SDP-a).	0.812642
At parliamentary elections in December 2011, a coalition of four left-of-centre parties won, and the president of SDP, Zoran Milanović, became prime minister.	Na parlamentarnim izborima u prosincu 2011. pobjeđuje koalicija četiriju stranaka lijevoga centra, a premijer postaje Zoran Milanović (predsjednik SDP-a).	0.445652
		0.3
Croatia was given the status of candidate country for EU membership on 18 June 2004, and accession negotiations began on 3 October 2005.	Status kandidata za članstvo u EU Hrvatska je dobila 18. ~~~ VI. ~~~ 2004, a pristupne pregovore započinje 3.	-0.143785
Croatia achieved an important foreign policy goal on 1 April 2009, by becoming a member of NATO.	X. ~~~ 2005. godine. ~~~ Bitan vanjskopolitički cilj Hrvatska je ostvarila 1. ~~~ IV.	-0.172984
At the end of June 2011, the accession negotiations were formally completed and on 9 December 2011, the Agreement on the Accession of Croatia to the European Union was signed (entered into force 1 July 2013).	2009, kad je postala članicom NATO-a. ~~~ Potkraj lipnja 2011. pristupni su pregovori formalno završeni te je 9. ~~~ XII. ~~~ 2011. potpisan Ugovor o pristupanju Hrvatske Europskoj uniji (na snagu stupa 1. ~~~ VII. ~~~ 2013). ~~~ Na referendumu održanom 22.	-0.248306
A referendum held on 22 January 2012 showed that two-thirds of those who voted (66.27%) were in favour of accession.	I. ~~~ 2012. dvije trećine izašlih birača (66,27%) izjasnilo se za pristupanje Hrvatske Europskoj uniji.	-0.00806452
At the end of 2011, the fifteen-year-long work of the Organisation for European Security and Cooperation (OESC) came to an end, which had been initiated in order to process war crimes committed in Croatia between 1991 and 1995, and supervise the return of refugees and the exercise of their rights.	Potkraj 2011. u Hrvatskoj je završeno i petnaestogodišnje djelovanje Organizacije za europsku sigurnost i suradnju, pokrenuto radi procesuiranja ratnih zločina počinjenih u Hrvatskoj 1991–95. ~~~ te povratka izbjeglica i ostvarenja njihovih prava.	-0.0189189
Foreign policy	Vanjska politika	0.257143
		0.3
International recognition and membership in the UN in 1992 enabled Croatia to adopt an independent approach to foreign policy, which until the mid 1990s was overshadowed by the events of war.	Međunarodno priznanje i članstvo u UN-u 1992. omogućilo je Hrvatskoj samostalan vanjskopolitički nastup, koji je do sredine 1990-ih bio u znaku ratnih zbivanja.	0.26014
It has only been post-war circumstances which have allowed the stronger international affirmation of Croatia, as confirmed by membership in NATO (2009) and the European Union (2013).	Tek poratne okolnosti omogućuju snažniju međunarodnu afirmaciju Hrvatske, što potvrđuje članstvo u NATO-u (2009) i Europskoj uniji (2013).	0.547821
Participation in Euro-Atlantic security and economic integration has been the most momentous goal of Croatian foreign policy.	Sudjelovanje u euroatlantskim sigurnosnim i ekonomskim integracijama bio je hrvatski težišni vanjskopolitički cilj.	0.291589
In this context, bilateral relations have been developed with the countries of the European Union and the USA.	U tom kontekstu razvijani su bilateralni odnosi sa zemljama Europske unije te SAD-om.	0.218919
At the same time, Croatian foreign policy has included other aspects of bilateral and multilateral activities, and many interstate relations have been established throughout the world.	Istodobno je hrvatska vanjska politika obuhvaćala i druge pravce bilateralnog i multilateralnoga djelovanja, te su uspostavljeni brojni međudržavni odnosi širom svijeta.	0.288312
Membership in all important international organisations and institutions has been achieved (OSCE, WTO, etc).	Ostvareno je članstvo u svim važnim međunarodnim organizacijama i institucijama (Organizaciji za europsku sigurnost i suradnju, Svjetskoj trgovinskoj organizaciji i dr.).	0.11875
As a country with a dramatic experience of war, Croatia has continued to contribute within the framework of the UN to peaceful conflict resolution in the world – in 2008–09 Croatia was a temporary member of the Security Council.	Kao zemlja s dramatičnim ratnim iskustvom, Hrvatska je u okviru UN-a nastojala pridonijeti mirnom rješenju sporova u svijetu – 2008/09. ~~~ bila je nestalna članica Vijeća sigurnosti.	-0.020307
		0.3
After the end of the Homeland War, Croatian involvement in the processes of regional cooperation and stabilisation has been through the Central European Free Trade Agreement, the Stability Pact for Southeastern Europe, and separate initiatives of the countries of the Danube region and of the Mediterranean, etc. ~~~ Croatia developed diplomatic relations with most neighbouring countries immediately after international recognition (Italy, Hungary, Slovenia and BiH).	Nakon završetka Domovinskoga rata hrvatski angažman u procesima regionalne suradnje i stabilizacije odvija se kroz Srednjoeuropski sporazum o slobodnoj trgovini, Pakt o stabilnosti za jugoistočnu Europu, zatim kroz inicijative podunavskih zemalja, sredozemnih zemalja i dr. Diplomatske odnose s većinom susjednih zemalja Hrvatska razvija odmah nakon međunarodnoga priznanja (Italija, Mađarska, Slovenija i BiH).	-0.0151226
In 1996 diplomatic relations were also established with the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, and after its collapse in 2006, with Serbia and Montenegro.	Godine 1996. uspostavljeni su i diplomatski odnosi sa Saveznom Republikom Jugoslavijom, a nakon njezina raspada 2006. sa Srbijom i Crnom Gorom.	0.285484
The The participation of Croatia and other post-Yugoslav countries in the processes of regional political stabilisation make the historical burdens of the past, including war, more complex.	Sudjelovanje Hrvatske i drugih postjugoslavenskih država u procesima regionalne političke stabilizacije složenim čine povijesna opterećenja, uključujući i nedavna ratna.	0.290566
This has been particularly expressed in the relations between Croatia and Serbia, while on the other hand, there has been greater success in restoring relations with Montenegro.	Izražena su napose u odnosima Hrvatske i Srbije, dok se s druge strane mnogo uspješnije prevladavaju u odnosima s Crnom Gorom.	0.181651
The legacy of the Yugoslav period includes issues such as individual border disputes, complex proprietary relations between the newly-formed states, the problems of the return of refugees, etc.	Naslijeđe iz jugoslavenskoga razdoblja jesu i pitanja pojedinih graničnih sporova, složenih imovinskopravnih odnosa među novonastalim državama, problemi povratka izbjeglica itd.	0.294512
Croatia is attempting to address these issues in accordance with international law and on the basis of mutual inter-state agreements.	Ta pitanja Hrvatska nastoji rješavati u skladu s međunarodnim pravom i na sporazumnoj međudržavnoj osnovi.	0.24433
This approach has, among other things, facilitated Croatia’s membership in the European Union.	Takav pristup omogućio je Hrvatskoj, među ostalim, i članstvo u Europskoj uniji.	0.250685
		0.3
Since 1999, Croatia participated in around twenty UN, NATO and EU peacekeeping operations and missions throughout the world.	Hrvatska je od 1999. sudjelovala u dvadesetak UN-ovih, NATO-ovih i EU-ovih mirovnih operacija i misija diljem svijeta s ukupno 6.000 vojnika.	0.261111
From 2005 to 2007, Croatian General Dragutin Repinc was the commander of an observer mission (UNMOGIP) on the disputed border between India and Pakistan in Kashmir.	Hrvatski general Dragutin Repinc bio je 2005–07. ~~~ zapovjednik UN-ove promatračke misije (UNMOGIP) na spornom indijsko-pakistanskom pograničju u Kašmiru.	0.122857
In early 2013, about 120 members of the Croatian armed forces participated in 7 UN missions, the majority (96) in the Golan Heights as part of an international observer force (UNDOF – United Nations Disengagement Observer Force).	Godine 2013. u 7 UN-ovih misija sudjeluje oko 120 pripadnika hrvatskih oružanih snaga; najviše ih je (96) na Golanskoj visoravni, u međunarodnim promatračkim snagama (UNDOF – United Nations Disengagement Observer Force).	2.17347
Since 2003, Croatia has been active in Afghanistan, as part of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) under NATO command, whose present composition includes 332 members of the Croatian armed forces.	Od 2003. ~~~ Hrvatska je aktivna i u Afganistanu, u okviru Međunarodnih snaga za podršku sigurnosti (ISAF – International Security Assistance Force), pod zapovjedništvom NATO-a, u sastavu kojih je 332 pripadnika hrvatskih oružanih snaga (2013). ~~~ Od 2009.	0.309878
Since 2009, about twenty Croatian soldiers have been part of the international Kosovo Force (KFOR), also under NATO command.	Hrvatska s dvadesetak vojnika sudjeluje u međunarodnim snagama na Kosovu (KFOR – Kosovo Force), također pod zapovjedništvom NATO-a.	0.421446

Potpis Sporazuma o stabilizaciji i pridruživanju u Bruxellesu 2001, prvi formalni korak prema članstvu u Europskoj uniji (predsjednik Vlade Ivica Račan i ministar vanjskih poslova Tonino Picula s predsjednikom Europske komisije Romanom Prodijem).	0.738424
Submitting the application for membership in the European Union in Athens in 2003 (Prime Minister Ivica Račan with the Greek Prime Minister Costas Simitis).	Podnošenje zahtjeva za pristup Europskoj uniji u Ateni 2003 (predsjednik Vlade Ivica Račan i grčki predsjednik Vlade Costas Simitis).	2.50966
Signature of the Treaty of Accession of Croatia to the European Union in 2011 (Prime Minister Jadranka Kosor and President Ivo Josipović, with EU leaders in Brussels). Joining NATO in Washington, with the ceremonious raising of the flag in Zagreb, 2009.	2012. ~~~ Pristup NATO-u u Washingtonu i svečano podizanje zastave u Zagrebu 2009.	0.103906
Croatia became a member of the largest military alliance in the world only 11 years after the withdrawal of UN peacekeeping troops from the country.	Hrvatska je postala članicom toga najvećeg vojnog saveza na svijetu samo 11 godina nakon povlačenja mirovnih snaga UN-a iz zemlje.	1.84534

The Šopot inscription, near Benkovac, mentioning Prince Branimir, who was recognised by Pope John VIII in 879 as the ruler of Croatia, while Croatia was recognised as an independent state.	Natpis iz Šopota kraj Benkovca s imenom kneza Branimira, kojega je 879. papa Ivan VIII. ~~~ priznao za vladara, a Hrvatsku za neovisnu državu.	-0.0495868
		0.3
The first Slavic tribes arrived in the area which is modern-day Croatia in the 6th and 7th centuries, during great tribal migrations.	Na prostor današnje Hrvatske prva slavenska plemena dolaze u 6. i 7. st. za velike seobe naroda.	0.186585
Among them were the Croats, who are mentioned in sources in connection with a wider area, but were ethnically most concentrated and historically the strongest in the hinterland of the Adriatic coastline.	Među njima bili su i Hrvati, koji se u izvorima spominju na širem prostoru, no etnički najkoncentriranije i povijesno najčvršće upravo u zaleđu jadranske obale.	0.239583
		0.3
In the late 8th and early 9th centuries, they came under Frankish rule (Charlemagne), and were organised in two adjoining principalities (Marks) governed by local princes.	Krajem 8. i početkom 9. st. podložni su franačkom vladaru Karlu I. Velikom, a organizirani u dvije pogranične kneževine (marke), u kojima vladaju domaći knezovi.	0.29375
The Principality of Dalmatian Croatia, with its seat in the Knin area, was established in what is today the coastal, mountainous area of southern Croatia, while the Principality of Pannonian Croatia was established in the lowlands of northern Croatia, with its seat in Sisak.	Na prostoru današnje primorske i planinske (južne) Hrvatske utemeljena je kneževina Hrvatska sa središtem u okolici Knina, a na prostoru nizinske (sjeverne) Hrvatske panonska kneževina sa središtem u Sisku.	0.222162
		0.3
In the late 9th century, the Pannonian Principality fell under the rule of the Hungarians, while power in the south was assumed by the Trpimirović dynasty.	Krajem 9. st. panonska kneževina potpada pod vlast Mađara, dok je vlast u južnoj Hrvatskoj preuzela narodna dinastija Trpimirovića.	0.264407
This dynasty began to ascend during the time of Tomislav (914–928), who expanded Croatia to the area of the Pannonian principality, and who in 925 was crowned as the first Croatian king.	Uspon te dinastije započeo je za Tomislava (914–928), koji je proširio Hrvatsku i na područje panonske kneževine, a 925. okrunjen je za prvoga hrvatskoga kralja.	0.386218
The Trpimirović dynasty reached its zenith with King Petar Krešimir IV (1054–78) and Dmitar Zvonimir (1078–89), when the Byzantine Dalmatia and Neretva Principality were annexed to Croatia.	Svoj vrhunac Trpimirovići su doživjeli za kraljeva Petra Krešimira IV. ~~~ (1054–78) i Dmitra Zvonimira (1078–89), kad su Hrvatskoj pripojene bizantska Dalmacija i Neretvanska kneževina.	0.104808
Their reigns were characterised by a blossoming of culture, particularly in building and sculpture.	Njihovu vladavinu obilježio je kulturni procvat, osobito graditeljstva i kiparstva.	0.256579
The first written monuments of the Croatian language date back to this period (the Baška Tablet).	Iz istog razdoblja potječu i prvi spomenici hrvatskoga jezika (Bašćanska ploča).	0.264
Jelena (?–976).	Jelena (?–976).	2.3
Jelena was a Croatian queen and wife of King Mihajlo Krešimir II (ruled 950–969) and the mother of King Držislav Stjepan (ruled 969–997).	Hrvatska kraljica, supruga kralja Mihajla Krešimira II. ~~~ (vladao 950–969) i majka kralja Držislava Stjepana (vladao 969–997).	0.172727
On her headstone, which was discovered in 1898, the royal title rex and genealogical details regarding the Trpimirović dynasty are recorded.	Na njezinoj nadgrobnoj ploči, otkrivenoj 1898, zabilježeni su vladarski naslov rex i genealoški podatci o dinastiji Trpimirovića.	0.623164
Croatian principalities in the 9th century	Hrvatske kneževine u 9. st.	0.144
Knin.	Knin.	1.8
From the time of the reign of the Trpimirović dynasty, Knin was the occasional seat of the Croatian rulers, and from the time of Dmitar Zvonimir, the permanent seat of the Croatian Kingdom, where from the 12th to 14th centuries, the herceg (duke) and the ban (governor) ruled alternately, and the sabor (parliament) held sessions.	Još od vladavine Trpimirovića Knin je bio povremena prijestolnica hrvatskih vladara, a od kralja Dmitra Zvonimira stalna prijestolnica Hrvatskoga Kraljevstva, u kojoj su od 12. st. do 14. st. naizmjence stolovali herceg i ban te se održavala zasjedanja sabora.	0.380973
St. Blaise.	Sv. ~~~ Vlaho.	-0.0136364
St. Blaise was Bishop of the City of Sebastea, a Christian martyr (mid 3rd century to c. 316), and patron saint of the city of Dubrovnik since 1190.	Biskup grada Sebaste i kršćanski mučenik (polovica 3. st. – oko 316), zaštitnik grada Dubrovnika od 1190.	0.552083
Dubrovnik developed from a fishing village in the early 7th century.		-0.3
It belonged at different times to the Byzantines, Normans, Venetians and the Croatian-Hungarian Kingdom, while from 1358 to 1808 it was an independent aristocratic republic.	Dubrovnik se razvio iz ribarskoga naselja početkom 7. st. Bio pod naizmjeničnom vlašću Bizanta, Normana, Mlečana (od 1205) i Hrvatsko-Ugarskoga Kraljevstva, a 1358–1808.	0.29
It traded in the Mediterranean, Levant and the Balkans.	neovisna plemićka republika. ~~~ Trgovao po Sredozemlju, Levantu i Balkanu.	-0.0394737
Kingdom of Croatia in the 11th century	Hrvatska kraljevina u 11. st.	0.219231
The Casket of St. Simeon.	Škrinja sv. ~~~ Šimuna.	0
The casket containing the relics of St. Simeon, on the main altar of the church of the same name in Zadar, was made in 1380 by the master goldsmith Francis of Milan.	Kovčeg s moćima sv. ~~~ Šimuna na glavnom oltaru istoimene crkve u Zadru izradio je 1380. majstor Franjo iz Milana.	-0.0545455
It is a masterpiece of Gothic goldsmithery and depicts the main historical events and personages of the 14th century, everyday scenes of life in Zadar and views of certain parts of the city.	To remek-djelo gotičkog zlatarstva prikazuje glavne povijesne događaje i ličnosti iz 14. st. te zadarsku svakidašnjicu i izgled pojedinih dijelova grada.	0.254348
Fallow deer in Brijuni National Park.	Jeleni u Nacionalnom parku Brijuni.	0.290625
Apart from its unspoiled nature, this park is also a place steeped in history, since the Declaration establishing the Non-Aligned Movement was signed there in 1956, during the Cold War.	Uz svoju netaknutu prirodu, park je i povijesno mjesto, jer je na jednom od njegovih otoka 1956. potpisana deklaracija kojom je za Hladnoga rata  postavljen temelj Pokretu nesvrstanih.	0.399627
	U 2011. osam hrvatskih nacionalnih parkova posjetilo je oko 2,3 milijuna turista.	-0.3
		0.3
A large number of protected natural areas and features show that Croatia is a country of exceptional, diverse, and comparatively well-preserved natural beauty, of which some examples, such as the Plitvice Lakes, are famous throughout the world.	Velik broj zaštićenih prirodnih područja i pojava pokazuje da je Hrvatska zemlja iznimnih i raznolikih te razmjerno dobro očuvanih prirodnih ljepota, od kojih su neke, poput Plitvičkih jezera, poznate u cijelom svijetu.	0.276804
The first legal norms in Croatia by which natural goods were protected date back to the 13th century, when deforestation in the area of Trogir, Korčula and Dubrovnik was restricted.	Prve zakonske norme u Hrvatskoj kojima se štite prirodna dobra potječu iz 13. st., kad je na području Trogira, Korčule i Dubrovnika bila ograničena sječa šuma.	0.274648
The movement to protect nature, founded by experts, began in the 19th century.	Stručno zasnovani pokret zaštite prirode javlja se potkraj 19. st. ~~~ 	-0.0120968
The Nature Protection Act defines 9 categories of spatial protection, and the most beautiful, most valuable protected areas comprise two strict reserves, eight national parks and eleven nature parks.	Zakon o zaštiti prirode određuje 9 kategorija prostorne zaštite, a najljepša i najvrednija područja zaštićena su u 2 stroga rezervata, 8 nacionalnih parkova i 11 parkova prirode.	0.384643
		0.3
Bijele Stijene and Samarske Stijene in Gorski Kotar and Hajdučki Kukovi and Rožanski Kukovi, in the area of North Velebit National Park, areas with irreplaceable natural features, are strict reserves.	U strogom rezervatu, području s neizmijenjenom prirodom, zaštićene su Bijele i Samarske stijene u Gorskom kotaru te Hajdučki i Rožanski kukovi na području nacionalnoga parka Sjeverni Velebit.	0.725083
		0.3
National parks cover extensive, unique areas with one or more preserved ecosystems.	Nacionalni parkovi obuhvaćaju prostrana i pretežno neizmijenjena područja s jednim ili više očuvanih ekosustava.	0.168493
The Plitvice Lakes National Park and the Krka National Park boast unique karst morphology and hydrology, with magnificent travertine waterfalls and lakes.	Nacionalni parkovi Plitvička jezera i Krka ističu se jedinstvenom krškom morfologijom i hidrologijom te veličanstvenim sedrenim slapištima i jezerima.	0.441045
Kornati and Mljet are island national parks with unique landscapes and abundant underwater worlds.	Kornati i Mljet otočni su nacionalni parkovi s jedinstvenim krajolikom i bogatim podmorskim svijetom.	0.686047
The Brijuni islands include cultivated parks and valuable cultural and historical heritage from classical times.	I Brijuni su otočje, ali obuhvaćaju kultivirane parkove te vrijednu kulturnu i povijesnu baštinu iz antičkoga razdoblja.	0.457197
Risnjak, Paklenica and North Velebit are mountainous areas with characteristic relief features, such as many limestone rocks and deep canyons, with high meadows and extensive woods, home to many endemic species.	Risnjak, Paklenica i Sjeverni Velebit planinska su područja s karakterističnim reljefnim značajkama poput brojnih vapnenačkih stijena ili dubokih kanjona, s visokoplaninskim travnjacima i prostranim šumskim kompleksima te endemičnim vrstama.	0.537363
		0.3
A nature park is a partially cultivated area with important ecological features, in which certain economic activities are permitted.	Park prirode dijelom je kultivirano područje s važnim ekološkim obilježjima u kojima su dopuštene određene gospodarske djelatnosti.	0.281739
Of the 11 nature parks in Croatia, 6 are in the mountains (Velebit, Biokovo, Medvednica, Papuk, Učka and Žumberak–Samobor Heights).	Od 11 parkova prirode 6 ih je planinskih, i to Velebit, Biokovo, Medvednica, Papuk, Učka te Žumberak-Samoborsko gorje.	2.78882
Telašćica and Lastovo islands are island parks whose qualities include a wide range of land and marine biodiversity.	Telašćica i Lastovsko otočje otočni su parkovi koje odlikuje velika kopnena i morska bioraznolikost.	0.467391
Kopački Rit and Lonjsko Polje are low-lying wetlands, habitats for rare animal species and home to original folk architecture.	Kopački rit i Lonjsko polje nizinsko--poplavna su područja sa staništima rijetkih životinjskih vrsta i izvornom pučkom arhitekturom.	0.600606
Vransko Lake is an especially important ornithological site for nesting and overwintering.	Vransko jezero iznimno je važno za gniježđenje i zimovanje ptica.	0.472727
		0.3
National and nature parks cover a total surface area of 5,151 km², which is 9.1% of the country.	Nacionalni parkovi i parkovi prirode zajedno obuhvaćaju površinu od 5151 km² ili 9,1% površine zemlje.	0.255556
Other protected nature categories are special reserves, regional parks, natural monuments, important landscapes, forest parks and monumental park architecture.	Ostale kategorije zaštićene prirode jesu posebni rezervat, regionalni park, spomenik prirode, značajni krajobraz, park-šuma i spomenik parkovne arhitekture.	0.295775
All nature protection activities are managed by the State Agency for Nature Protection.	Svim aktivnostima u zaštiti prirode upravlja Državni zavod za zaštitu prirode.	0.283333
		0.3
Certain protected areas have been included in the international system for nature protection.	Pojedina zaštićena područja uključena su u međunarodne sustave zaštite prirode.	0.280519
The Plitvice Lakes are on the World Natural Heritage List; Mount Velebit and the Mura–Drava–Danube regional park are part of an international network of biosphere reserves (Man and the Biosphere – MAB), while Kopački Rit, Lonjsko Polje, the Neretva Delta, Crna Mlaka and Vransko Lake (since 2013) are on the international list of valuable wetlands (Ramsar Convention).	Plitvička jezera nalaze se na Popisu svjetske prirodne baštine; planina Velebit i regionalni park Mura–Drava–Dunav dijelovi su međunarodne mreže rezervata biosfere MaB (Man and the Biosphere), a Kopački rit, Lonjsko polje, Delta Neretve, Crna Mlaka, a od 2013. i Vransko jezero, nalaze se na popisu međunarodno vrijednih močvara (Ramsarska konvencija).	0.82465
Papuk Nature Park is part of the European network of geoparks.	Park prirode Papuk dio je europske mreže geoparkova.	0.928369
		0.3
With Croatia’s entry into the EU, all protected areas, along with those which have been recognised as valuable, will become part of the Nature 2000 ecological network of land and marine sites.	Ulaskom Hrvatske u Europsku uniju sva zaštićena područja, ali i ona prepoznata kao vrijedna postaju dijelom ekološke mreže kopnenih i morskih područja Natura 2000.	0.265306
Endemic flora and fauna	Endemična flora i fauna	1.48571
		0.3
The flora of Croatia is characterised by biological diversity (biodiversity) and has its own peculiar quality.	Obilježja flore na području Hrvatske velika su biološka raznolikost (biodiverzitet) i osebujnost.	0.28
In terms of the number of plant species found, Croatia is ahead of most European countries.	Po broju zastupljenih biljnih vrsta Hrvatska je ispred većine europskih zemalja.	0.279167
Due to climate differences and the position of coastal areas, which are in the Mediterranean region, the vegetation in such areas is quite different in composition and appearance from the lowland and mountainous areas inland, which belong to the Euro-Siberian region.	Zbog klimatskih razlika i položaja primorska područja Hrvatske, koja se nalaze u mediteranskoj regiji, po sastavu i izgledu vegetacije bitno se razlikuju od ostalih nizinskih i planinskih područja u unutrašnjosti zemlje, koja se nalaze u eurosibirskoj regiji.	0.3
This is particular evident in forest vegetation, but can also be seen in other types of ground cover.	To je izraženo u šumskoj vegetaciji, ali i u ostalim tipovima biljnoga pokrova.	0.235714
		0.3
Apart from biological diversity, peculiarity is also important, as reflected in the large number of endemic species, mostly on the Adriatic islands and mountain ranges of Biokovo and Velebit.	Osim biološke raznolikosti važna je i osebujnost, što se ogleda u velikom broju endemičnih vrsta, najviše na jadranskim otocima i planinskim masivima Biokova i Velebita.	0.274172
There are 8,871 species and subspecies of Croatian flora (according to some estimates, over 10,000), of which 526 (about 6%) are endemic, and 1,088 (about 12%) protected.	Hrvatska flora obuhvaća 8.871 vrstu i podvrstu, a prema nekim procjenama ima ih i više od 10 000, od čega je 526 endemičnih (oko 6%), a zaštićenih 1.088 (oko 12%).	1.58152
		0.3
Croatian fauna consists of all animal species which live permanently or occasionally in the country.	Hrvatskoj fauni pripadaju sve životinjske vrste koje trajno ili privremeno žive na njezinu području.	0.286207
In Croatia, there is an overlap of a range of animal species characteristic of northern Europe and those which mostly live in the western or eastern Mediterranean.	Na području Hrvatske preklapaju se areali životinjskih vrsta karakterističnih za sjevernije dijelove Europe te onih koje pretežito obitavaju u zapadnom, odnosno u istočnom Sredozemlju.	0.356957
		0.3
According to current knowledge, there are 23,876 species and subspecies of Croatian fauna, of which 565 (2.4%) are endemic and 1,624 (6.8%) protected.	Prema dosadašnjim spoznajama hrvatska fauna obuhvaća 23 876 vrsta i podvrsta, od toga ih je 565 (2,4%) endemično, a 1624 (6,8%) zaštićeno.	0.426764
Endemic species are found in almost all animal groups, but most are found among species which live in the karst region and the rivers which flow into the Adriatic, and on the islands.	Endemi se nalaze u gotovo svim skupinama životinja, a najbrojnija su među vrstama koje žive na krškom području, rijekama jadranskoga slijeva i na otocima.	0.267153
There are 88 species of fish in the karst rivers of the Adriatic confluence, of which 41 are endemic, while over 50% of reptiles are endemic.	U krškim rijekama jadranskoga slijeva živi 88 vrsta riba, od kojih je 41 endemična, a među gmazovima više od 50%.	1.96329
The underground karst world is even more diverse: the Dinaric karst has the highest density of troglobite species in the world (80).	Krško podzemlje još je raznolikije; dinarski je krš po broju troglobionata najbogatije područje na svijetu (80 vrsta).	0.285981

Opeka, not far from Varaždin, the most famous arboretum, along with Trsteno near Dubrovnik	Opeka nedaleko od Varaždina, uz Trsteno kraj Dubrovnika najpoznatiji arboretum.	0.543561
The wolf (Canis lupus) is one of three strictly protected large beasts in Croatia	Vuk (Canis lupus), jedna od triju strogo zaštićenih velikih zvijeri u Hrvatskoj.	0.517726
The griffon vulture (Gyps fulvus) is another endangered species. ~~~ There are over 70 nesting pairs in two ornithological reserves on the island of Cres.	Bjeloglavi sup (Gyps fulvus), ugrožena vrsta; na otoku Cresu u dvama ornitološkim rezervatima prebiva više od 70 gnijezdećih parova.	0.933333
Bats (Chiroptera) are regular inhabitants of underground caves	Šišmiši (Chiroptera), redoviti stanovnici podzemnih špilja.	0.283929
The white stork (Ciconia ciconia), a protected species with about 1,500 nesting pairs in Croatia	Bijela roda (Ciconia ciconia), u Hrvatskoj se gnijezdi oko 1.500 parova te zaštićene vrste.	0.692593
The otter (Lutra lutra), a protected species	Vidra (Lutra lutra), zaštićena vrsta.	1.275
The brown bear (Ursus arctos).	Smeđi medvjed (Ursus arctos).	1.48889
In Kuterevo on Mount Velebit there is a bear sanctuary for cubs orphaned as a result of accidents or poaching.	U Kuterevu na Velebitu nalazi se utočište za mladunčad nesretnim slučajem ili krivolovom odvojenu od majke.	0.283696
The olm (Proteus anguinus) is endemic to the Dinaric karst region	Čovječja ribica (Proteus anguinus), endemična vrsta dinarskoga krša.	0.579762
The bottlenose dolphin (Tursiops truncatus) lives mostly in the waters around the island of Lošinj	Dobri dupin (Tursiops trucantus), najviše boravi u akvatoriju otoka Lošinja.	0.504156
The lynx (Lynx lynx), a strictly protected species, is a permanent inhabitant of Gorski Kotar and Lika	Ris (Lynx lynx), strogo zaštićena vrsta, stalno naseljuje područje Gorskoga kotara i Like.	0.710279
Velebit degenia (Degenia velebitica), the best known endemic species, also grows on Mount Velebit	Velebitska degenija (Degenia velebitica), najpoznatija endemična vrsta, raste na Velebitu.	0.838226
The Croatian carnation (Dianthus croaticus) is an endemic species which grows in Gorski Kotar and Lika	Hrvatski klinčić (Dianthus coaticus), endemska vrsta, raste u Gorskom kotaru i Lici.	0.483401
The Croatian iris (Iris croatica) is an endemic species which grows in the northern part of the country	Hrvatska perunika (Iris croatica), endemska vrsta, raste u sjevernom dijelu zemlje.	0.497297

croatica), a relic of the Tertiary period, grows on Mount Velebit	croatica), tercijarni relikt, raste na Velebitu.	0.646753
The most famous Croatian historical regions are Dalmatia, lying along most of the Adriatic coast with its islands, Slavonia, bordered by the Drava, Danube and Sava rivers, and Istria, the main peninsula in the northern Adriatic.	Od povijesnih hrvatskih regija najpoznatije su Dalmacija, duž većega dijela Jadranske obale s otocima, Slavonija na sjeveroistoku zemlje, između Drave, Dunava i Save, te Istra, poluotok na sjevernom Jadranu.	0.281967
		0.3
The region of modern Croatia covers a large number of historical and geographical regions of different origins and size.	Današnje područje Hrvatske obuhvaća veći broj povijesnih i zemljopisnih regija različita podrijetla i veličine.	0.294175
These reflect the political fragmentation of the Croatian lands in the past, and partly also the position of Croatia at the meeting-point of several large, geographical, European components.	One su odraz političke razjedinjenosti hrvatskih zemalja u prošlosti, a dijelom i položaja Hrvatske na dodiru nekoliko velikih zemljopisnih sastavnica Europe.	0.253521
The best known historical regions are Dalmatia, Slavonia and Istria.	Od povijesnih regija najpoznatije su Dalmacija, Slavonija i Istra.	0.294915
Historical regions	Povijesne regije	0.2625
		0.3
The original Roman province of Dalmatia extended along the east coast of the Adriatic Sea, but also included a significant part of the hinterland, which today belongs to Bosnia and Herzegovina.	Prvotna rimska pokrajina Dalmacija pružala se duž istočne jadranske obale, ali je obuhvaćala i znatan dio zaleđa, koji je danas u sastavu Bosne i Hercegovine.	0.248571
Byzantine Dalmatia, on the other hand, included only a few coastal towns and neighbouring islands.	Bizantska pak tema Dalmacija obuhvaćala je samo nekoliko obalnih gradova i obližnjih otoka.	0.289024
The region which is considered to be Dalmatia today was formed as a Venetian territory on the eastern Adriatic by the late 17th and early 18 century. ~~~ This territory, enlarged by the addition of the Dubrovnik Republic in the 19th century, formed a separate province within the Habsburg Empire.	Područje koje se danas drži Dalmacijom oblikovano je kao venecijanski teritorij na istočnom Jadranu potkraj 17. i početkom 18. st. Isti teritorij uvećan za područje Dubrovačke Republike u 19. je stoljeću bio zasebna pokrajina u sastavu Habsburškoga Carstva.	-0.011087
		0.3
The peninsula in the north of the eastern Adriatic has been called Istria since Roman times.	Istrom se od rimskog doba nazivao poluotok na sjevernom dijelu istočne obale Jadrana.	0.288
In the 19th century, it formed a separate unit within the Habsburg Empire.	U 19. stoljeću bila je zasebna jedinica u okviru Habsburškoga Carstva.	0.3
Although its population was predominantly Croatian, it was only formally annexed to Croatia after the Second World War.	Iako po narodnosnom sastavu prevladavajuće hrvatska, formalno je Hrvatskoj priključena tek nakon Drugoga svjetskog rata.	0.282524
		0.3
The name Slavonia used to refer to a larger area than today – it covered the entire region north of the Velika and Mala Kapela mountain range.	I naziv Slavonija prvotno se odnosio na veće područje nego danas – tako se nazivalo područje sjeverno od planinskog masiva Velike i Male Kapele.	0.399832
From the 18th century onwards, the name came to be used for the eastern, lowland area of modern-day Croatia, and formed part of the title of the Croatian political core area within the Habsburg Empire – the Kingdom of Croatia and Slavonia.	Od 18. st. taj se naziv ustalio za istočni, nizinski dio današnje Hrvatske, a bio je i sastavni dio službenog naziva za politički matično hrvatsko područje u sastavu Habsburškoga Carstva – kraljevina Hrvatske i Slavonije.	0.377242
Other historical and geographical names relate to smaller regions, whose borders are sometimes not clearly defined.	Ostali povijesni i zemljopisni nazivi odnose se na manje regije, katkad bez jasno određenih međa.	0.247674
The northeast region of Baranja was once part of a Hungarian county of the same name, but has been part of Croatia since 1945.	Sjeveroistočna regija Baranja dio je nekadašnje istoimene ugarske županije, a u sastavu je Hrvatske od 1945.	0.631292
The most eastern part of Slavonia is known as Srijem, and is the relic of a once much larger region, most of which belongs to Serbia today.	Najistočniji dio Slavonije naziva se Srijem i ostatak je nekad prostranije cjeline, od koje je veći dio danas u sastavu Srbije.	0.289091
Lika, Banovina, Kordun and Žumberak are smaller regions, which were wholly or partially under the separately administrated Military Frontier set up by the Habsburg Empire on what is Croatian soil today.	Lika, Banovina, Kordun i Žumberak manje su regije, koje su u cijelosti ili djelomično bile u sastavu posebno upravljanog područja Vojne granice što ga je na današnjem hrvatskom području ustrojilo Habsburško Carstvo.	0.643966
The Military Frontier was re-integrated with the main Croatian territories in 1881.	Vojna granica sjedinjena je s matičnim hrvatskim teritorijem 1881.	0.535
		0.3
Some of these names and other names of regions appear in the names of modern counties, the basic units of the administrative division of the country, but they have exclusively geographical significance and do not denote any particular political status.	Pojedini spomenuti nazivi te i drugi nazivi regija pojavljuju se u nazivima suvremenih županija, temeljnih jedinica upravno-teritorijalne podjele zemlje, no imaju isključivo zemljopisno značenje i ne označuju poseban politički status.	0.392509
Contemporary regions	Suvremena regionalna podjela	0.195
		0.3
Contemporary regional divisions basically follow the relief division of the country.	Suvremena regionalna podjela u osnovi prati reljefnu podjelu zemlje.	0.231148
The northern, predominantly lowland part of the country is divided into Eastern and Central Croatia.	Sjeverni, pretežito nizinski dio zemlje dijeli se na istočnu i središnju Hrvatsku.	0.252
Eastern Croatia includes the traditional regions of Slavonia, Baranja and the western part of Srijem, i.e. ~~~ the actual lowland area of the Pannonian Plain, bordered by the largest rivers, the Sava, Drava and Danube.	Istočna Hrvatska obuhvaća tradicionalne regije Slavoniju, Baranju i zapadni dio Srijema, odnosno pravi nizinski prostor Panonske zavale, omeđen najvećim rijekama Savom, Dravom i Dunavom.	-0.0142857
This area boasts the optimal conditions for agricultural production.	To je i područje s najpovoljnijim uvjetima za poljoprivrednu proizvodnju.	0.27541
The main regional capital is Osijek, a port on the Drava.	Glavno je regionalno središte Osijek, luka na Dravi.	0.62695
Other large towns include Vinkovci, a transport hub, Vukovar, the largest river port and the only Danube port in the country, Slavonski Brod, Požega and Đakovo.	Veći su gradovi Vinkovci, prometno čvorište, Vukovar, najveća riječna i jedina dunavska luka u zemlji, te Slavonski Brod, Požega i Đakovo.	1.08961
		0.3
Central Croatia includes the border areas of the Pannonian Plain and the peri-Pannonian regions of Croatian Zagorje, Međimurje, Pokuplje and Banovina.	Središnja Hrvatska obuhvaća krajnje rubne dijelove Panonske zavale te peripanonska područja Hrvatskog zagorja, Međimurja, Pokuplja i Banovine.	0.29771
It is the centre of gravity in terms of population and the economy, with the country’s capital, Zagreb.	Ona je populacijsko i gospodarsko težište zemlje s glavnim gradom Zagrebom.	0.207353
Other large towns and regional centres are Varaždin, Čakovec and Krapina in the north part of the region, Karlovac and Sisak in the south and Bjelovar and Koprivnica in the east.	Ostali veći gradovi i regionalna središta jesu Varaždin, Čakovec i Krapina u sjevernom dijelu regije, Karlovac i Sisak u južnom te Bjelovar i Koprivnica u istočnom.	1.0675
Highland Croatia is the smallest, least populated region, and includes the country’s mountainous area.	Gorska Hrvatska najmanja je i najrjeđe naseljena regija, a obuhvaća planinsko područje zemlje.	0.27907
It is composed of smaller units, particularly the forested Gorski Kotar, the Ogulin–Plaški depression and Lika.	Sastoji se od manjih cjelina, izrazito šumovitoga Gorskoga kotara, Ogulinsko-plaščanske udoline i Like.	0.284211
Due to the relief and climate, there is little arable land, and only cultures which can withstand severe winter conditions are grown there.	Zbog reljefa i klime obradivih je površina malo, te se uzgajaju samo kulture koje podnose oštre klimatske uvjete.	0.242424
Forestry based on local resources is the dominant branch of the economy.	Šumarstvo temeljeno na lokalnim resursima dominantna je gospodarska grana.	0.270968
The towns are smaller than in other parts of the country, and the regional centres are Delnice, Ogulin and Gospić.	Gradovi su manji nego u ostalim dijelovima zemlje, a regionalna su središta Delnice, Ogulin i Gospić.	0.802445
		0.3
The coastal part of the country is usually divided into north and south.	Za primorski dio zemlje uvriježena je podjela na sjeverni i južni dio.	0.295082
The Northern Litoral area includes Istria, the most developed tourist region, and the long, narrow Kvarner region below Velebit, with the islands which belong to it.	Sjeverno hrvatsko primorje obuhvaća poluotok Istru, najrazvijeniju turističku regiju, te usko i izduženo kvarnersko i podvelebitsko primorje s pripadajućim otocima.	0.280851
The largest town and regional centre is Rijeka, the largest Croatian port.	Najveći je grad i regionalno središte Rijeka, najveća hrvatska luka.	0.567965
Other large towns include Pula and Poreč in Istria, and Senj in the coastal belt below Velebit, while there are particular tourist centres such as Rovinj and Opatija, and the island centres of Krk, Rab and Mali Lošinj.	Veći su gradovi Pula i Poreč u Istri te Senj u podvelebitskom primorju, a izrazito su turistička središta Rovinj i Opatija te otočna središta Krk, Rab i Mali Lošinj.	1.01931
The Southern Litoral forms the historical region of Dalmatia.	Južno hrvatsko primorje povijesna je regija Dalmacija.	0.276
In terms of climate, landscape and culture, it is a specifically Mediterranean region, within which three parallel belts can be distinguished: the islands, the coast and the hinterland.	To je klimatski, krajolički i kulturološki izrazit mediteranski prostor, unutar kojega se razlikuju tri usporedna pojasa: otoci, obala i zaleđe.	0.230233
The regional centre is Split, the second largest city in Croatia and the largest on the coast.	Regionalno je središte Split, drugi grad po veličini u Hrvatskoj i najveći na obali.	0.484
Other important regional and economic centres include the coastal towns of Zadar, Šibenik and Dubrovnik, and the inland towns of Knin and Sinj.	Važna regionalna i gospodarska središta još su obalni gradovi Zadar, Šibenik i Dubrovnik te Knin i Sinj u unutrašnjosti.	0.708333
Historical regions	Povijesne i zemljopisne regije	0.133333

Dubrovnik, an independent republic (city state) from the 14th to the 19th century, and later part of the Austrian province of Dalmatia	Dubrovnik, neovisna republika (grad-država) od 14. do 19. st., a potom dio austrijske pokrajine Dalmacije.	0.42367

Sisak, a 16th century fortress	Sisak, utvrda iz 16 st.	0.695
The Zagreb&ndash;Split motorway (A1), Žuta Lokva intersection.	Autocesta Zagreb&ndash;Split (A1), čvor Žuta lokva.	1.53061
Croatia has over 1,250 km of motorways, of which about 1,000 km were built in the last fifteen years.	Hrvatska ima preko 1250 km autocesta, od čega je oko 1000 km izgrađeno u posljednjih petnaest godina.	0.619048
Brinje Tunnel, on the A1 motorway, was awarded the FIA prize in Brussels in 2008 as one of the safest tunnel in Europe.	Tunel Brinje, na autocesti Zagreb&ndash;Split, progla&scaron;en je 2008. u Bruxellesu jednim od najsigurnijih tunela u Europi.	0.257143
		0.3
As an Adriatic, Central European country, and part of the Danube valley, Croatia enjoys a favourable geo-communication position.	Kao jadranska i srednjoeuropska, pa i podunavska zemlja Hrvatska ima povoljan geoprometni položaj.	0.218182
Thus several pan-European transport corridors and their branches pass through Croatia, as defined at a ministerial conference in 1997 in Helsinki: Corridor X links Central Europe and the Near East, while branches of Corridor V link northern and southern Europe with final destinations in Croatian ports.	Preko Hrvatske stoga prolazi nekoliko paneuropskih prometnih koridora i njihovih ogranaka, definiranih na ministarskoj konferenciji 1997. u Helsinkiju: X. koridor povezuje Srednju Europu i Bliski istok, a ogranci V. koridora povezuju sjever i jug Europe s krajnjim točkama u hrvatskim lukama.	0.365523
Croatian sea ports have traditionally been points of exit for several Central European land-locked countries (Austria, Hungary, Slovakia, Czech Republic) and for neighbouring Bosnia and Herzegovina.	Hrvatske morske luke tradicionalno su izlazne luke za nekoliko srednjoeuropskih zemalja bez vlastite morske obale (Austrija, Mađarska, Slovačka, Češka) te za susjednu Bosnu i Hercegovinu.	0.289286
		0.3
Due to the shape and indentation of its territory, good transport communications are important for Croatia too, particularly in linking the interior with the coast, and the Pannonian region with the Adriatic front.	Zbog oblika i razvedenosti teritorija dobra prometna povezanost važna je i za samu Hrvatsku, a posebice na smjerovima koji povezuju unutrašnjost s obalom, njezin panonski dio s jadranskim pročeljem.	0.284483
In terms of transport communications, optimum solutions direct Croatia to Bosnia and Herzegovina and vice versa.	Kad je o prometnoj povezanosti riječ, optimalna rješenja upućuju Hrvatsku na Bosnu i Hercegovinu i obratno.	0.29375
In addition, the narrow B&H exit to the sea near Neum divides the territory of Croatia into two sections.	Osim toga, uski bosanskohercegovački izlaz na more kraj Neuma dijeli hrvatski teritorij na dva dijela.	0.293182
A suitable solution is still being sought in order to fully link the Dubrovnik coastal region with the rest of Croatia, and this has become a subject of international interest as Croatia enters the European Union.	Za potpunu povezanost dubrovačkog primorja s ostatkom Hrvatske još se uvijek traži prikladno rješenje, koje s ulaskom Hrvatske u Europsku uniju postaje i predmetom međunarodnog interesa.	0.278443
One possibility is a highway, which would form one section of the Adriatic-Ionian highway project, along the Croatian coast from Italy to Greece.	Moguće je rješenje autocesta, kao dionica projekta Jadransko-jonske autoceste, od Italije do Grčke, duž jadranske obale.	0.261818
Otherwise, about 1,000 km of modern highways have been built in the last 15 years in international corridors.	Inače, oko 1.000 km modernih autocesta u posljednjih 15 godina izgrađeno je upravo na međunarodnim koridorima.	2.39829
There is a long tradition of building transport communications in Croatia.	Gradnja prometnica u Hrvatskoj ima dugu tradiciju.	0.166667
The first modern roads were built as early as the 18th century, leading from the interior to the northern Adriatic ports, while the first railway line was built in 1862, linking Zagreb by a branch line to the main Vienna–Trieste line.	Prve moderne ceste izgrađene su već u 18. st., iz unutrašnjosti prema lukama na sjevernom Jadranu, dok je prva željeznička pruga izgrađena 1862, kad je Zagreb povezan ogrankom na prugu Beč–Trst.	0.447845
Road transport is the most developed, most important form of land communication, and transports the greatest amount of passenger and goods traffic.	Cestovni je promet najrazvijeniji i najvažniji oblik kopnenog prometa, kojim se prevozi najviše putnika i robe.	0.215152
The existing highway network is well developed and enables good connections within the country.	Postojeća mreža autocesta dobro je razvijena i omogućuje dobru povezanost unutar zemlje.	0.292593
Croatia has seven international airports and three smaller airfields for small commercial aeroplanes.	Hrvatska ima 7 međunarodnih zračnih luka i 3 zračna pristaništa za manje zrakoplove komercijalne namjene.	0.28
Sea ports are of particular significance in the transport network.	Morske luke imaju posebno značenje u prometnoj mreži.	0.244898
The largest, most important Croatian port is Rijeka, followed by Ploče, which handles all the traffic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.	Najvažnija je i najveća hrvatska luka Rijeka, a uz nju i Ploče, preko koje ide sav promet Bosne i Hercegovine.	0.535188
The other Croatian ports are primarily important as passenger terminals and provide communication between the mainland and islands.	Ostale jadranske luke ponajprije su važne u putničkom prometu te za povezivanje kopna s otocima.	0.194118
The total length of inland waterways is 804 km, and international traffic primarily uses the Danube (for which the main port is Vukovar) and, to a lesser extent, the Drava and Sava.	Ukupna duljina plovnih putova iznosi 804 km, a međunarodni promet odvija se ponajprije Dunavom (glavna je luka Vukovar), a u manjoj mjeri Dravom i Savom.	1.63881
The Danube waterway, in which Croatia participates, is one of the pan-European transport corridors (VII).	Dunavski plovni put u kojem Hrvatska participira jedan je od paneuropskih prometnih koridora (VII. ~~~ koridor).	-0.00815217
Plans have been drawn up for a Danube–Sava canal to link the waterways.	Za povezivanje plovnih putova postoji idejni projekt kanala Dunav–Sava.	0.280645
The current state of transport communications is satisfactory in terms of road traffic, particularly the extent of highway connections.	Sadašnje stanje prometnica zadovoljava u cestovnom prometu, ponajprije kad je riječ o izgrađenosti autocesta.	0.246
Particular deficiencies exist in the renovation and modernisation of the railway infrastructure and inland waterways.	Izraziti zaostatci prisutni su u obnovi i modernizaciji infrastrukture željeznica i unutarnjih plovnih putova.	0.284848
Pan-European traffic corridors	Paneuropski prometni koridori	0.289286
Carsko Vrilo by the road from Karlovac to Senj (known as the Jozefina Road), built in the 18th century	Carsko vrilo uz cestu Karlovac–Senj (Jozefina), građenu u 18. st.	0.447727
Transport map	Prometna karta	0.276923
Croatian Revival, by Vlaho Bukovac, the curtain at the Croatian National Theatre in Zagreb.	Hrvatski preporod, Vlaho Bukovac, svečani zastor Hrvatskoga narodnog kazališta u Zagrebu.	0.788608
Croatia has 60 professional theatres where more than 8,733 performances were given in 2012 to over 1.7 million viewers.	U Hrvatskoj djeluje 60 profesionalnih kazališta i 7 stalnih scena, u kojima je u 2012. održano 8733 predstave, s više od 1,7 milijuna gledatelja.	0.379412
In addition, more than 2,800 performances were put on in children's theatres, and more than 1,100 in amateur theatres.	Uz to je u profesionalnim kazalištima za djecu održano preko 2800 predstava, a u amaterskim kazalištima oko 1100 predstava.	0.276238
		0.3
The earliest examples of theatrical life in Croatia, as in other Western countries, were liturgical dramas in Latin.	Početci kazališnoga života u Hrvatskoj, kao i u drugim zemljama zapadne civilizacije, liturgijske su drame na latinskom jeziku.	0.258
However, secular theatre appeared as early as the beginning of the 14th century in Dubrovnik, which over the next centuries emerged as the leading theatrical centre and the largest Croatian stage.	No svjetovno se kazalište pojavilo već početkom 14. st. u Dubrovniku, koji će i u sljedećim stoljećima kao glavno književno središte biti i najveća hrvatska pozornica.	0.270395
It reached its zenith in the highly-developed theatrical forms of the 16th and 17th centuries, in which the original comedy theatre pieces of Marin Držić were dominant, and in various dramatic forms of a particularly Baroque character (Ivan Gundulić and Junije Palmotić).	Osobito je to došlo do izražaja u visokorazvijenim kazališnim oblicima 16. i 17. st., u kojima dominiraju autorsko komediografsko kazalište Marina Držića te različiti dramski oblici izrazito baroknih obilježja (Ivan Gundulić, Junije Palmotić).	0.547138
This was an era in which other Croatian centres joined enthusiastically in theatrical life, whether in Dalmatia (Hvar and Zadar) or especially inland (Zagreb, Varaždin and Osijek), where a major role was played by Jesuit school productions, and performances were gradually relocated from public buildings to theatres.	To je i razdoblje u kojem se kazališnomu životu snažnije priključuju i druga hrvatska središta – ona dalmatinska (Hvar, Zadar) i osobito kontinentalna (Zagreb, Varaždin, Osijek), u kojima su najbitniju ulogu imale isusovačke školske priredbe, a predstave se s javnih prostora postupno sele u dvorane.	0.488911
In 1834 a theatre opened on St. Mark’s Square in Zagreb, which in the Renaissance period, thanks to the efforts of Dimitrija Demeter, began gradually to organise Croatian professional theatrical life.	Na zagrebačkom Markovu trgu otvorena je 1834. kazališna zgrada, u kojoj se u doba preporoda, zauzimanjem Dimitrija Demetra, počeo postupno organizirati hrvatski profesionalni kazališni život.	0.415385
The first performance in Croatian (Juran i Sofija, by Ivan Kukuljević Sakcinski), was staged in 1840, and the first opera (Ljubav i zloba, by Vatroslav Lisinski) in 1846.	Prva predstava na hrvatskom jeziku (Juran i Sofija Ivana Kukuljevića Sakcinskog) izvedena je 1840, a prva opera (Ljubav i zloba Vatroslava Lisinskoga) 1846. godine.	1.1358
		0.3
Up to 1860, German theatre companies continued to perform alongside their Croatian counterparts, but after the official institutionalisation of the national theatre in 1861, during the next decade August Šenoa, as artistic director, redirected the repertoire towards Slav and Romance authors.	Sve do 1860. uz hrvatske dramske družine i nadalje nastupaju njemačke, a nakon zakonske institucionalizacije nacionalnoga glumišta 1861, u sljedećih će deset godina August Šenoa, kao njegov umjetnički ravnatelj, repertoarnu sliku preusmjeriti na slavenske i romanske autore.	0.527086
At the end of the 19th century, Stjepan Miletić became the theatre manager, having acquired experience through studying the European stage, which he brought to his homeland, carrying out reforms which during his tenure were characterised by the important impulses of modern Croatian theatre.	Potkraj 19. st. intendantom je postao Stjepan Miletić koji je iskustvo stečeno studijem europskih pozornica prenio u domovinu, provevši reforme koje su njegovo razdoblje obilježile važnim impulsima hrvatske kazališne moderne.	0.42409
Between the two World Wars, all theatrical issues were affected by political interference.	Kazališni život između dvaju svjetskih ratova trpio je politička upletanja u sva kazališnoscenska pitanja.	0.224051
However, under the management of Julije Benešić in the 1920s, the directorship of Branko Gavella and the work of scenographer Ljubo Babić, the Zagreb theatre achieved a high level of artistic performance, while other Croatian theatres succeeded in maintaining their independence.	Zagrebačko kazalište ipak je za intendanture Julija Benešića 1920-ih, djelovanjem redatelja Branka Gavelle i scenografa Ljube Babića, ostvarilo visoke umjetničke domete, a i druga su hrvatska kazališta uspjela sačuvati svoju samostalnost.	0.264055
After 1945, a series of new, professional theatres was established, while amateur theatricals also received support, becoming a polygon for alternative and avant-garde performances, particularly with the founding of the Experimental Student Theatre.	Nakon 1945. osnovan je niz novih profesionalnih kazališta, a podupirao se i scenski amaterizam, koji će, osnutkom Studentskoga eksperimentalnoga kazališta, biti poligon za alternativno kazalište i avangardna scenska ostvarenja.	0.279412
Festivals with there tradition of performing using local monuments as a natural setting, like the Dubrovnik Summer Festival (launched in 1950) and the Split Festival (launched in 1954), with their international flavour, contributed to the affirmation of the national theatre abroad.	Festivali ambijentalnoga kazališta Dubrovačke ljetne igre (od 1950) i Splitsko ljeto (od 1954) svojim su međunarodnim obilježjem pridonijeli afirmaciji nacionalnoga kazališta i u inozemstvu.	0.298613
		0.3
In 1954, the Gavella Drama Theatre began operating.	Godine 1954. počelo je djelovati Dramsko kazalište »Gavella«.	0.206667
This marked the beginning of pluralism on the national cultural scene, which became evident in repertoire, staging, and other organisational aspects.	Početak je to pluralizma u nacionalnoj scenskoj kulturi, koji će biti vidljiv u repertoaru, scenskoj slici i različitim organizacijskim aspektima.	0.297692
New stages (Teatar & TD in Zagreb), followed by a series of independent, or rather amateur groups which promote a wide range of theatrical forms (Teatar u gostima, Histrioni, Pozdravi, Coccolemocco, Kugla-glumište, Montažstroj), along with specialised theatres for particular genres and purposes (Zagreb Puppet Theatre, Zagreb Youth Theatre, Komedija, Kerempuh Satirical Theatre) and festival competitions, of which the most important are the Fadil Hadžić Days of Satire (Zagreb) Marul’s Days (Split), the Small Scene Theatre Festival (Rijeka), the Children’s Festival (Šibenik), PIF (an international puppet festival in Zagreb), and Eurokaz (a festival of avant-garde and experimental theatre in Zagreb), have enabled the realisation of a multi-faceted repertoire with a variety of interpretative polymorphisms as the basic characteristics of modern Croatian theatre.	Nove pozornice (Teatar &TD u Zagrebu), a potom niz slobodnih, odnosno amaterskih skupina koje promiču najraznovrsnije kazališne oblike (Teatar u gostima, Histrioni, Pozdravi, Coccolemocco, Kugla-glumište, Montažstroj), kao i specijalizirana kazališta za određene žanrove i namjene (Zagrebačko kazalište lutaka; Zagrebačko kazalište mladih; Komedija; Satiričko kazalište Kerempuh) te smotre natjecateljskih obilježja, od kojih su najvažniji Dani satire Fadila Hadžića (Zagreb), Marulovi dani (Split), Festival malih scena (Rijeka), Festival djeteta (Šibenik), PIF (međunarodni lutkarski festival, Zagreb), Eurokaz (smotra avangardnoga i eksperimentalnoga teatra, Zagreb), omogućile su realizaciju repertoarne višestrukosti te interpretativne polimorfnosti kao temeljnih značajka suvremenoga hrvatskoga glumišta.	0.861538
Ulysses Theatre, founded in 2001, also holds a popular place on the theatrical scene, as it seeks to combine great works of world drama with the unique setting of the island of Mali Brijun. ~~~ Ballet ~~~ 	Popularno mjesto na kazališnoj sceni ima i 2001. utemeljeno Kazalište Ulysses, koje svoj izraz temelji na spajanju velikih djela svjetske dramske literature s jedinstvenim ambijentom otoka Mali Brijuni.	-0.078893
The beginnings of the Croatian ballet tradition were linked to the mid 19th century Zagreb theatre, but the arrival of a Russian ballerina, teacher and choreographer, Margarita Froman, in 1921, ushered in a new period of development.		-0.3
A plethora of excellent dancers and choreographers emerged from her school, among whom were Mia Čorak-Slavenska, Ana Roje, Oskar Harmoš and Sonja Kastl.		-0.3
The School of Classical Ballet was founded in Zagreb in 1949. ~~~ The art of ballet was celebrated in the second half of the 20th century by Vesna Butorac-Blaće, Irena Pasarić, Almira Osmanović, Dinko Bogdanić andTomislav Petranović, and particularly by Milko Šparemblek, who danced in the Maurice Béjart Ballet du XXe Siècle ensemble and was Director of the Metropolitan Ballet in New York, the Gulbenkian Ballet in Lisbon and the Lyon Ballet.		-0.3
		0.3
Modern dance in Croatia was cultivated in parallel with the emergence of different trends in Europe.	Moderni se plesni izraz u Hrvatskoj njegovao usporedo s nastajanjem njegovih smjerova u Europi.	0.289157
From the late 1920s, the following were active in Zagreb: Mercedes Goritz-Pavelić, a student of Mary Wigman and Gertrud Bodenwieser in Vienna and Munich, Mirjana Dragana Janaček, who established her school on the dance expressions of Isadora Duncan, and Ana Maletić, a disciple of the Rudolf Laban school, whose Rhythm and Dance School (1945) still bears her name today.	Od kraja 1920-ih u Zagrebu djeluju Mercedes Goritz-Pavelić, učenica Mary Wigman i Gertrud Bodenwieser u Beču i Münchenu, Mirjana Dragana Janeček, koja je svoju školu temeljila na plesnom izrazu Isadore Duncan, te Ana Maletić, sljedbenica škole Rudolfa Labana, čija škola za ritmiku i ples (1954) danas nosi njezino ime.	0.92383
These schools have produced generations of dancers, among whom are some of the founders or members of the best known modern dance ensembles – the Modern Dance Studio, the Chamber Ensemble of Free Dance and the Zagreb Dance Ensemble.	Iz te su škole potekle generacije plesača, među njima utemeljitelja i članova najpoznatijih plesnih trupa: Studio za suvremeni ples, Komorni ansambl slobodnoga plesa i Zagrebački plesni ansambl.	0.260345
The dance scene today is very active, with a major role being played by the international festival Modern Dance Week, which has been organised in Zagreb since 1984.	Plesna scena danas je vrlo živa, a veliku ulogu u tom odigrao je međunarodni festival Tjedan suvremenog plesa, koji se od 1984. organizira u Zagrebu.	0.507332

In 2012, the top 1,000 Croatian companies made HRK 428 billion (EUR 57 billion) in revenue, while at the same time they earned HRK 17 billion (EUR 2.3 billion) profit. Croatian Water (Hrvatske vode), a water management company, was founded in 1996 for the protection of the water assets of the country and to ensure the constant availability of water for the needs of the population and industry, on the basis of the principles of sustainable development.	Hrvatske vode, poduzeće za upravljanje vodama, osnovano 1996. radi zaštite vodnoga bogatstva zemlje te osiguranja trajne dostupnosti vode za potrebe stanovništva i gospodarstva na načelima održiva razvoja.	0.207568
		0.3
The Croatian Electricity Company (Hrvatska elektroprivreda), was founded in 1990 to work in the production, transmission and distribution of electricity, and the supply and distribution of gas and heating.	Hrvatska elektroprivreda, elektroenergetska tvrtka osnovana 1990; bavi se proizvodnjom, prijenosom i distribucijom električne energije te opskrbom i distribucijom plina i topline.	0.268323
It has 25 hydroelectric power stations and 8 thermal power stations, which use heating oil, natural gas and goal as fuel.	U svom sastavu ima 25 hidroelektrana i 8 termoelektrana, koje se kao pogonskim gorivom koriste loživim uljem, prirodnim plinom i ugljenom.	1.88342
		0.3

Jadranski naftovod, poduzeće za upravljanje sustavom prijenosa nafte za domaće i inozemne korisnike, skladištenje nafte i naftnih derivata te prekrcaj tekućih tereta, osnovano 1974.	-0.0285276

Croatian Radiotelevision (Hrvatska radiotelevizija) is the media institution comprising Croatian Radio (founded in 1936) and Croatian Television (founded in 1956).	Hrvatska radiotelevizija, medijska ustanova koju čine Hrvatski radio (osnovan 1926) i Hrvatska televizija (osnovana 1956).	0.392045
		0.3

It has a fleet of 50 ships (4 large passenger ferries for coastal transport and international lines, 33 ferries for local passenger transport, 8 catamarans, a hydrobus and 4 classical ships).	U svom sastavu ima flotu od 50 brodova (4 velika putnička trajekta za dužobalnu plovidbu i međunarodne linije, 33 trajekta u lokalnom putničkom prometu, 8 katamarana, hidrobus i 4 klasična broda).	1.68773
