Bogoslav Šulek	Bogoslav Šulek	2.3
Pope John Paul II during his first pastoral visit to Croatia in 1994		-0.3
The “Golden Gate” was erected between the years 29 and 27 BC by the Sergi family, in honor of three members of the family who held important positions in Pula at that time.		-0.3
This triumphal arch leaned against the city gate Porta Aurea thus called because of its richly ornamented arch or gilded elements.		-0.3
The gate and wall were pulled down in the beginning of the 19th century as a result of the city expansion outside the city walls.		-0.3
The Arch was constructed in Corinthian style with strong Hellenistic and Asia Minor influences both in the method and ornaments.		-0.3
As the eastern side was not visible it has remained for the most part uncarved, while the western, town side is richly decorated.		-0.3
Today numerous cultural performances, theatrical and musical, are held on the square next to the Arch.		-0.3
The adjacent street is a shopping area.	Papa Ivan Pavao II.	0
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ The Museum has several departments – Department of the history of Pula, Department of medieval Istrian history and the Department of modern Istrian history with adjoining collections (Cultural-historic collection of urban life, Collection of old postcards and photographs, Collection of maritime history and shipbuilding, Collection of economic development, Cultural-historical collection of suburban life, Collection of insignia, diplomas, seals and coats-of-arms, Coin collection, Collection of arms, uniforms and military equipment, Collection of film and video recordings, Collection of memoirs and phonographic recordings, Collection of significant persons and the recently established Collection of old maps. ~~~ In the rich museum holdings (over 40,000 artifacts), particularly important is the collection of old postcards, maps and the collection of arms, uniforms, military and maritime equipment. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ From the upper circular street one of the perpendicular paths leads to the top of the central hill of the city where a star-shaped castle with four bastions was built in 1630. ~~~ Wishing to protect the city and its harbor, because of it great significance in maritime trade in the North Adriatic, the Venetians commissioned the building of the Castle from the French military architect Antoine de Ville. ~~~ This was most probably the site of an earlier fortress dating from the pre-Roman and Roman period. ~~~ The Histrian hill-fort was primarily built for defensive purposes, whereas in the Roman period a small military garrison was stationed here. ~~~ Today the Castle houses the Historical Museum of Istria. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ The Marine Casino was built in 1872 according to the plans of Viennese architect L. Baumann, as a place for leisure and entertainment of Austro-Hungarian officers and their families. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ The Naval cemetery, dating from 1866, is the site where 150,000 soldiers from the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy (until 1918) were buried.		-0.3
It is located in the direction of Stoja.	u prvom pastoralnom pohodu Hrvatskoj 1994.	0.264706
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
On the northeastern slopes of the central hill of the city, below the Castle are the remains of a Roman theater: in addition to the Amphitheater, Pula had two other theaters during the Roman period.		-0.3
The larger one, which has not been preserved, was situated outside the city, on the slopes of Zaro hill (Monte Zaro), south of the city walls.		-0.3
The other theater known as the Small Roman Theater was situated within the city walls.		-0.3
The remains of scene, semicircular orchestra and tired section for the audience have partly been reconstructed.		-0.3
Below the theater is the building of the one-time German Royal Gymnasium, which in 1930 became the Archaeological Museum of Istria.		-0.3
Today the museum displays a rich collection of prehistoric, classical and early medieval monuments found in Istria.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
After some modifications in the collection of stone monuments and having displayed the remaining exhibits, in 1949 the museum reopened as the specialized Archaeological Museum of Istria.		-0.3
By systematic work and with great efforts, after having restituted part of the archaeological objects from Italy in 1961, the museum building was gradually renovated and the museum exhibits displayed in a representative didactical-visual concept.		-0.3
The reconstructed collection of stone monuments on the ground floor and museum halls reopened in 1968.		-0.3
In 1973 the prehistoric room on the 1st and the classical, late Roman and medieval exhibits on the 2nd floor of the museum opened.		-0.3
The museum halls of the Archaeological Museum of Istria are constantly being extended; supplemented with new finds from archaeological sites in Istria (prehistoric caves, hill forts and necropolises, Roman economic complexes, buildings and cemeteries, as well as sacral edifices from the early Christian and Byzantine period, the barbaric invasion and the settlement of the Slavs in Istria). ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
It is one of the two chapels built in the 6th century as part of a large Benedictine abbey demolished in the 16th century.		-0.3
The floor and walls were decorated with mosaics, some of which are now in the Archaeological Museum of Istria.		-0.3
It was built in the style of Ravenna churches, the only difference being the use of stone instead of brick.		-0.3
Due to its dimensions, method of construction and good state of preservation, the Chapel represents an extraordinary architectural masterpiece of its time.	Glagoljica je staroslavensko pismo koje nastaje početkom 9. stoljeća i koristi se do početka 19. stoljeća kada sve veću ulogu dobiva latinica.	0.281102
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
Built in the second half of the 6th century, with a typical Ravenna-like polygonal apse, the church was dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary.		-0.3
After its radical reconstruction around 1200, it was assigned to the Greek Orthodox community in Pula in 1583 formed by immigrants from Cyprus and Nauplion: Today it belongs to the Serbian Orthodox church.		-0.3
It keeps the iconostasis of the Greek master Tomios Batos from the 18th century, valuable icons and other objects.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Glagoljica je u početku bila obla, a potom uglata te je imala 32 znaka.	0.284211
The oldest preserved remains of the church wall from the beginning of the 4th century can be seen from outside: the lower part of the rear wall belongs to this period.		-0.3
Due to a fire in 1242 the church underwent reconstruction on several occasions.		-0.3
While the upper windows of the nave were built in the early Christian period, the windows of the aisles bear typical Gothic traits.	Ima brojevnu vrijednost tako da su prvih devet slova jedinice, a slijedećih devet desetice, daljnjih devet stotice pa tisućice.	0.294545
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ After the Arsenal was founded in 1856, Pula faced a period of intensive building, marked by the construction of new buildings mostly related to the activities of the main naval port of the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy: from the Naval hospital and Naval cemetery to numerous barracks of the Hydrographic Institute, Marine Casino, military and civil buildings, residential buildings for officers and civil servants, as well as residential buildings for workers and lower grade clerks. ~~~ In 1903 was the inauguration of the Market, a covered construction. ~~~ At that time it was an extraordinary event, because for the first time iron and glass were used as the newest building material. ~~~ That is why it was very popular and apeared very often on postcards.		-0.3
The whole mantel creating the outside wall was made entirely of iron construction supports and glass surfaces. ~~~ The trading areas in the ground floor are spacious and functional, and till today the building has not lost its purpose, the belly of the town.	Najjača upori&scaron;ta glagolja&scaron;a su Hrvatsko primorje, Istra i otok Krk gdje su pronađeni najstariji spomenici, na kamenu, iz 12. i 13. st: Valunska ploča, Plominski natpis, Grdoselski i Supetarski ulomak i Ba&scaron;ćanska ploča.	-0.00140845
It is the centre of the morning town life and everyone who wishes to feel the spirit of the Mediterranean should pass through its fish-market, take a glance at stalls with fruits and vegetable, take a coffee on its terrace and eavesdrop the morning throng and buzz of the town.		-0.3
Especially interesting are the great number of private villas for higher ranked officers and civil servants, mostly located in the southern suburb Sv.		-0.3
Policarp.	Glagoljica	0.27
The houses with one or two apartments were set along quiet streets and surrounded by greenery.		-0.3
Numerous ornaments, sculptures and architectural details bear the features of Viennese Secession that gave entire Pula an air of a Central European city.	Glagoljica je staroslavensko pismo koje nastaje početkom 9. stoljeća i koristi se do početka 19. stoljeća kada sve veću ulogu dobiva latinica.	0.288189
Some of the finest examples are Villa Horty, Villa Wolf and many others.	Glagoljica je u početku bila obla, a potom uglata te je imala 32 znaka.	0.295
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
On the slope of the hill between the Forum and the upper circular street, lies the monastic complex dedicated to St. Francis of Assisi, built in the 14th century at the site of a previous cultic edifice.		-0.3
The Franciscan community was first recorded in Pula in the 13th century.		-0.3
The church was built in 1314 in the late Romanesque style with Gothic ornaments, as a firm and simple building of the preaching Franciscan order.		-0.3
The finely cut stone blocks used for building the walls speak of the skilful masters who took part in the construction.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The main square of classical and medieval Pula is situated at the foot of the central hill, in the western part of the city close to the sea.		-0.3
The coast where the Forum was constructed in the 1st century BC had to be filled up to gain a larger area.		-0.3
The Forum was the nucleus of city life, its religious, administrative, legislative and commercial center.		-0.3
On the northern part of the Forum stood two twin temples and a central one dedicated to Jupiter, Juno and Minerva.		-0.3
Today only the Temple of Augustus has been fully preserved while of the second temple only the back wall, built into the Communal Palace in the 13th century, is visible.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
It stands between two, most probably medieval towers, of simple construction built of uncarved stone blocks.		-0.3
At the top of the damaged arch, although hardly recognizable, is a carving of the head of Hercules and his club.		-0.3
Close to the club is a damaged inscription, most interesting in the historical context since it contains the names of two Roman officials, Lucius Calpurnius Piso and Gaius Cassius Longinus to whom the Roman Senate had entrusted the duty to found a Roman colony at the site of today’s Pula.		-0.3
Thus, between 47 and 44 BC Pula was founded as a settlement with urban features.		-0.3
Since the upper circular street passed though this gate, the axis of communication was obliquely placed with respect to the direction of the city walls.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
After the bombing of World War II remains of Roman houses with mosaics were found under the block of houses around the Chapel of St. Maria Formosa.		-0.3
The most impressive one is surely the floor mosaic with the central field presenting the mythological scene of the “Punishment of Dirce”(Amphion and Zethus are tying Dirce to an enraged bull, since out of envy Dirce had been cruel to their mother Antiope.)		-0.3
This figural scene presents the central field of a large floor mosaic composition (12 m x 6 m).		-0.3
The entire mosaic composition is divided into two equal sections with altogether 40 decorated areas dominated by geometrical patterns with animal details (fish and bird).		-0.3
The mosaic covered the floor of a central room of a Roman house, probably from the 3rd century.		-0.3
It has been preserved at the site where it was found, so that the level of house floors in the Roman times, which is 2 m below today’s level, is clearly visible.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
At the time when Pula was a free municipality, a palace was erected in the Forum – the seat of the municipal self-government.		-0.3
During the Venetian rule it was the seat of the duke and provveditore, and until the present has remained the seat of the mayor.		-0.3
Additions over the centuries (from the 10th -16th centuries) led to a building that in an exceptional way combines architectural styles from the Romanesque until the Renaissance.		-0.3
The inscription built in the facade, which was restored in the 16th century, dates the construction of the Communal Palace to 1296.	Ima brojevnu vrijednost tako da su prvih devet slova jedinice, a slijedećih devet desetice, daljnjih devet stotice pa tisućice.	0.297297
The year probably refers to the first greater reconstruction and addition, because this was surely the seat of the municipal government even earlier.		-0.3
Earlier phases of the development of the Communal Palace in terms of its construction can best be seen on the eastern wall where Romanesque and Gothic styles intertwine.		-0.3
Sculptures of Telamon and Siren in the corners closed by Renaissance columns, and Baroque windows are the latest alterations of the outer appearance of the Communal Palace: neglect and negligence have left considerable traces on the building that has recently been radically restored. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The most famous and important monument, the starting and ending point of every sightseeing tour is the Amphitheater, popularly called the Arena of Pula, which was once the site of gladiator fights.		-0.3
It was built in the 1st century AD during the reign of Emperor Vespasian, at the same time as the magnificent Colosseum in Rome.		-0.3
The ground plan is elliptical, the longer axis measuring about 130 m and the shorter one about 100 m. Gladiator fights took place in the central flat area called the arena, while the spectators could sit on the stone tiers or stand in the gallery.		-0.3
It is believed that the Amphitheater could seat about 20,000 spectators.		-0.3
Local limestone was used for its construction. ~~~ In the Middle Ages it was the site of knights tournaments and fairs. ~~~ The underground passages, once used by the gladiators, nowadays host a regular exhibition of viticulture and olive growing in Istria in ancient times.	Najjača upori&scaron;ta glagolja&scaron;a su Hrvatsko primorje, Istra i otok Krk gdje su pronađeni najstariji spomenici, na kamenu, iz 12. i 13. st: Valunska ploča, Plominski natpis, Grdoselski i Supetarski ulomak	-0.100535
The exhibits include reconstructions of machines once used for the production of olive oil and wine (mills, presses, vessels) and amphorae used for storing and transporting olive oil and wine.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
It covers an area of 480 square meters and is an ideal venue for lectures and concerts.		-0.3
The museum and gallery center is situated in the one-time Church of the Sacred Hearts that was built by the nuns of that holy order in 1908. The church was closed after World War II, and was then given to the Archaeological Museum of Istria.		-0.3
Its renovation began in 1994 and so, after 17 years Pula finally has a very impressive museum and gallery center. ~~~ Working Hours: ~~~ May, June 9.00 – 21.00, ~~~ July, August 9.00 – 23.00		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ The Museum has several departments – Department of the history of Pula, Department of medieval Istrian history and the Department of modern Istrian history with adjoining collections (Cultural-historic collection of urban life, Collection of old postcards and photographs, Collection of maritime history and shipbuilding, Collection of economic development, Cultural-historical collection of suburban life, Collection of insignia, diplomas, seals and coats-of-arms, Coin collection, Collection of arms, uniforms and military equipment, Collection of film and video recordings, Collection of memoirs and phonographic recordings, Collection of significant persons and the recently established Collection of old maps. ~~~ In the rich museum holdings (over 40,000 artifacts), particularly important is the collection of old postcards, maps and the collection of arms, uniforms, military and maritime equipment. ~~~  ~~~  ~~~ Prices ~~~  ~~~ Adults       Kuna 20,00       Euro 2,80 ~~~  ~~~ Students and groups       Kuna 10,00       Euro 1,40 ~~~  ~~~ Children       Kuna 5,00       Euro 0,70 ~~~  ~~~ Info: tel. ~~~ 00385 52 211 740 ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ New attraction: Austro-Hungarian underground tunnels in the center of Pula ~~~  ~~~ Ticket prices: ~~~ adults: 15.00 kuna ~~~ children under 15 years: 5,00 kuna ~~~ studentsa and agency groups: 10.00 kuna ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ The museum collects works of art created in the second half of last century until the latest work of recent artists. ~~~ MCAI represents an open meeting place of multiculturalism and, above all, to be a leading cultural and art institution of Istrian artists.		-0.3

This publication is dedicated to the Istrian composer Antonio Smareglia.		-0.3
It is being published on the occasion of the 150th anniversary of the composer’s birth and of the opening of the memorial room in the composer’s birth-house in Pula.	Njome su pisane crkvene knjige, gradski statuti i zakonici, klesani su natpisi na kamenim pločama, urezivane poruke na raspela, zvona i oslikane zidove crkava.	0.291304
The establishment of the memorial room was sponsored by the government of Italian Region of Veneto, the County of Istria, and the City of Pula.		-0.3
The exhibited material has been donated by the composer’s daughter, the late Silvia Smareglia, her two children, Adua Smareglia Rigotti and the late Silvano Smareglia, and the composer’s great-granddaughters Annamaria Smareglia Borgioli and Mariarosa Rigotti Longo.		-0.3
The exhibition also includes the artwork by the sculptor Alfredo Sficco, the painter Gualtiero Mocenni and other artists who had dedicated some of their work to Smareglia.		-0.3
We would like to express our thanks to the rest of the contributors who had made donations, to the Italian music publisher Casa Musicale Sonzogno di Piero Ostali and to the Teatro Comunale “Giuseppe Verdi” in Trieste. ~~~ Augustov prolaz 3 ~~~ Opening hours: ~~~ 11:00 to 12:00, ~~~ Saturdays and Sundays closed ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The House of Istrian Olive Oil tells the story of olive growing in Istria through history up to the present day.	Danas je to neprocjenjivo nasljeđe najbolje sačuvano upravo u sredi&scaron;njim krajevima Istre.	0.513724
You can also find out how the ancient Romans processed olive oil and how it is produced today. ~~~ Discover all the aromas and tastes, as well as the chemical composition of Istrian extra virgin olive oil and learn how olive oil, combined with the Mediterranean diet affect our health.	Tu je u na&scaron;e vrijeme podignut jedinstven spomenik glagoljskoj kulturi i pismenosti - Aleja glagolja&scaron;a s jedanaest spomen-obilježja postavljenih uz cestu između gradića Roča i Huma	-0.0152866
During your visit, you will learn from an expert how to recognize top-quality extra virgin olive oil, which makes Istria particularly famous as a region.	Bazilika u Betigi, koja se nalazi s lijeve strane ceste između sela i novog turističkog naselja, posvećena je svetom Andriji.	0.245455
In the Museum shop, you can find a large selection of top Istrian extra virgin olive oils.		-0.3
The leading Istrian olive oil producers offer a wide variety of the very best extra virgin olive oils.		-0.3

Amphorae are specific vessels that were used for storing and transporting olive oil, wine, salted fish and preserved fruit.		-0.3
They were also used for building as construction and insulating material, as well as for filling in swampy areas.	Mnogi će se upitati &scaron;to predstavljaju čavli zabijeni među blokove vanjskog zida te lijepe crkvice.	0.296842
The characteristic Istrian amphora has a very pronounced egg-shaped body with long neck narrower than the body and small handles on opposite sides.	Predaja kaže da su ih tijekom minulih vremena na Veliku Gospu zabijale nerotkinje u uvjerenju da će nakon toga milo&scaron;ću Božjom zanijeti.	0.3

For all nature lovers and hiking devotees, Pula is the perfect place to enjoy such a hobby.		-0.3
In the surroundings of Pula there are some a hundred kilometers of marked hiking trails.		-0.3
About 30 kilometers of trails, some of which are close to the sea, pass through the famous Šijana Forest near Pula.		-0.3
This well known forest, whose original name is Kaiserwald or Imperial Forest, is just as pleasant in spring and summer.		-0.3
 So, if you want to spend your holidays discovering the many trails, stop by at the Tourist Office Pula, Forum 3 for a map of the hiking routes in the area.		-0.3

Research that began last year in the building of the Archaeological Museum, which is currently being renovated, already shows that this institution conceals treasures, not only within its walls, but also below the surface.		-0.3
Altogether 232 sq meters, 4 meters in height have been researched.		-0.3
In addition to many finds from Antiquity, a layer with regularly arranged amphorae that served for draining away water and fragments of stone monuments have been found.		-0.3

The Temple, situated in the Forum, is dedicated to goddess Roma and Emperor Augustus.		-0.3
It was constructed between the year 2 BC and AD 14 when the Emperor died.		-0.3
According to its shape it follows the typical pattern of temples.		-0.3
The function of the Temple changed through the years: with the ending of the pagan ancient era its original pagan function ceased and the temple was afterwards used as a church, granary, and in the beginning of the 19th century it was a museum for stone monuments. ~~~ In 1944 it was hit by a bomb and completely destroyed.		-0.3
It was reconstructed between the years 1945 and 1947 and nowadays it houses a collection of ancient stone and bronze sculptures.		-0.3
The other twin temple, of which only the back wall is preserved, is believed to have been constructed at the same time and in the same style and was called the Temple of Diana.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
At one of the most beautiful spots in Pula, Monte Zaro Park, you will find the Pula Observatory which offers not only the great view of the sky and stars but also of the town centre and the Pula Bay.		-0.3
You can take a look at the sky above Pula if you call 091/533 0 304.		-0.3
We were told by the astronomers that the best time to look at the stars is in the evening.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3

Pula Film Festival is the oldest film festival in Croatia and one of the oldest film festivals in Europe.		-0.3
Its trademark is the Arena, where the film screenings take place under the stars.		-0.3
Today it is the most visited cultural event in the Republic of Croatia, with over 73,000 visitors attending the great number of festival events.		-0.3
The festival program takes place at different city locations, attracting a large number of visitors.		-0.3

Visualia Festival – the festival of light, presents the magic and beauty of new technologies and audiovisual art and at the same time has a great impact on city branding.		-0.3
Pula’s Visualia Festival was held for the first time in 2013, with 3D Mapping, and its program has been increasing every year.		-0.3
Already the following year it also included the “Lighting Giants”, illuminated cranes of Uljanik Shipyard, which have become the city’s new attraction and symbol.		-0.3
In 2015, the Guinness world record was broken in the Arena, for the largest photography of people forming a light sign, known as the “Light Postcard”.		-0.3
Last year, Visualia Festival was included in the calendar of international light festivals.		-0.3
During the three days of Visualia, this festival attracts around 10,000 visitors, who enjoy this unique and unforgettable experience.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
In the second half of the 19th century, in the area beneath the old Kaštel, a park was designed.		-0.3
Paths were built, flowerbeds arranged, grass sown, trees planted.		-0.3
The area was later transformed into a marketplace.		-0.3
In the beginning of the 20th century some hundred hackberry trees were planted in four rows that even nowadays offer shade to the citizens of Pula and chance-travelers.		-0.3
The old photograph shows that the planted trees were properly raised in one of the then nurseries with a very finely developed crown and straight trunk.		-0.3
All seedlings were of the same habitus.	AntunaUz crkvu je kapela sv.	0.192
Some of them did not stand the test of time, so that only eighty have remained until the present being the most precious green oasis in the heart of the city.		-0.3
The trees are a silent witness of changes of government, culture and generations in Pula.		-0.3
Nowadays they are about twenty meters high.		-0.3
From the vast promenade the stairs led to the City museum.		-0.3
They were at the same time a communication of the city, extending beyond the city walls, with the old core of Kaštel.		-0.3
Since Pula had a streetcar communication from one side of the city to another during the Austro-Hungarian rule, one of the city lines led along Giardini.		-0.3
Beside the road and along the promenade there were streetlights giving a romantic atmosphere.		-0.3
East of Giardini is the Roman monument – the Triumphal Arch of the Sergi, one of the points of interest on a sightseeing tour of the city and the reason why there are so many people at Giardini.		-0.3
In the deep shade of the trees the caterers have spread out their cafés so that you can have a drink enjoying the murmur of tiny leaves.		-0.3
Throughout its history Giardini was the meeting place and site of various events. ~~~ Already in the first half of the 20th century book fairs and occasional sales were held here.	Antuna, koju je 1381. godine od pravilno klesanih kamenih blokova podigao majstor Almerigo, a 1486. godine obnovio pićanski biskup Paskazije, rodom iz Grači&scaron;ća.	0
This tradition continued even later so that it was the site of film projections, concerts and other social events.		-0.3
“Korzo”, as the promenade was named after the War, thus became the main social gathering place.		-0.3
The photograph from the beginning of the century still shows the green belt between the line of trees and the upper road, which was all that remained from the previous gardens.		-0.3
That belt was greatly reduced during the bombing in World War II.		-0.3
After the War, remains of the city walls were found and reconstructed.		-0.3
Archaeological excavation around the Triumphal Arch of the Sergi in 1995 removed the last remains of greenery.		-0.3
The beautiful holm oak planted at the beginning of the century was pulled down, as well as the hedge of bitter orange (Poncirus trifoliatus), the only example in Pula.		-0.3
Presently, apart from the canal, Giardini is separated from the old city walls of Kaštel, by a hedge of firethorn (Pyracantha coccinea).		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
If you wish to escape from the swarming streets and sweltering heat of the city on a summer afternoon into a colorful autumn or a scented spring morning you should go to Šijana Forest.		-0.3
Surely you won’t regret it.	Crkva Sv.	-0.266667
Only two kilometers from the very center of the city you will find heaven for your body and soul.		-0.3
The narrow winding labyrinth-like paths at every curve reveal surprises, a small animal or a beautiful specimen of forest flora.		-0.3
Through the tall tree tops the sunrays shyly protruding just to enable you to see where a certain path leads.		-0.3
It is equally nice here in spring when the soil is covered with fragrant carpets of cyclamen and in autumn when under the fallen leaves you can discern caps of many species of mushrooms.		-0.3
Admire them in their natural habitat, rather than picking them!		-0.3
All flora and fauna in this forest is protected, so all you can take home are memories of such lovely sights.	Agate nalazi se na staromu gradskom groblju i primjer je troapsidalne romaničke sakralne arhitekture.	0.3
There is a legend that is connected with Šijana Forest.		-0.3
On Good Friday in 1271 members of the wealthy Castropola family of Pula were killed by conspirators.		-0.3
The loyal servant only managed to save the son and hide him in the Franciscan monastery where he was brought up.		-0.3
Later, in gratitude he offered Šijana to the monastery.		-0.3
In 1860 the administration over the forest was taken over by the navy.		-0.3
At the beginning of the last century it was called Kaiserwald (Imperial Forest), when it served as a rest area and recreation grounds for the Austro-Hungarian army and gentry.	Zanimljiva je zbog svoje trobrodne strukture natkrivene dvoslivnim krovom te zbog specifičnog sveti&scaron;ta izduženoga kornim prostorom sredi&scaron;nje apside.	0.3
They came to the forest by various means of transport: carriages, cars, bicycles and already at the time there was a need to design the park and connect the streetcar with the center.		-0.3
In recent detailed research Šijana park forest is described as a community of downy oak and oriental hornbeam, and the immediate vicinity of sea water, with the vegetation area of holm oak, is why this species appears more often in the warmer locations of the forest.		-0.3
Šijana park forest covers an area of 152.13 hectares and characteristic are examples of foliates and conifers.		-0.3
Visitors should be enabled to discover the values of specific species due to their impressiveness and rareness.		-0.3
Such are examples of cork oak (Quercus suber), downy oak (Quercus pubescens) and Turkish pine (Pinus brutia).		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
It does not extend from other parks in town.	Crkva se datira u rasponu od 9. do 13. stoljeća.	0.267568
It has a rectangular shape and a total surface of 3,000m2.		-0.3
The exceedingly beautiful developed trees of large-leaf linden (Tilia platyphyllos) offer a mild scent and pleasant shade during hot summer days.		-0.3
Dried flowers of this beautiful deciduous species make a tasty hot or cold drink successfully used in curing cardiovascular disorders.	Uz pretpostavljeni karolin&scaron;ki utjecaj, na crkvi su vidljiva obilježja regionalne sakralne arhitekture ranog srednjeg vijeka.	0.292241
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The park named after the twinned-city of Pula lies in the very center of the city between the main pedestrian and automobile communication directions.		-0.3
It was built in 1957 on the ruins of buildings destroyed in air raids, so that the base on which it lies is inadequate and does not meet the requirements of a modern city park.		-0.3
Although it is not grand by design, it attracts attention because of the archaeological remains scattered in the park which is why it was called Archaeological Park until the 1960s.		-0.3
In its center lies a group of nice holm oak, the Istrian autochthonous oak, a species that dominates on the vegetation map of Istria.	U unutra&scaron;njosti se nalaze dva kasnobarokna kipa domaće izrade (anđeli luečono&scaron;e) i oltarna slika sv.	0.279808
We find here a unique example of wild-growing fig tree – Mediterranean fruit, which is a must among Istrian food.		-0.3
Figs can be eaten fresh, dried, in brandy, jam and fig cake.		-0.3
Along the road between the tall hackberry trees lie shrubs of myrtle (Myrtus communis).		-0.3
This Mediterranean plant is naturally found in Istrian vegetation and is yet another “aromatic” member of Mediterranean flora.		-0.3
Namely, myrtle essential oil successfully cures respiratory problems and builds the immune system.		-0.3
NEWLYWED’S PARK	Agate. ~~~ Crkva Sv.	0
It was designed in the 1950s, but gained its full splendor at the end of the century when the automatic irrigation system was introduced.		-0.3
Since then its area of over 1,000 m2 has been well tended, colorful annuals planted and shrubs and hedges trimmed and clipped.		-0.3
The decorative illumination beneath the slender cypresses creates a special atmosphere in the park at night, so that newlyweds after saying the great “I do” often take pictures on the bench of this park.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Agate restaurirana je i konzervirana 1993 -1995. godine. ~~~ Crkve	0
The park is a logical continuation of the previous park and was built in 1953 on an area of 3,380m2.		-0.3
In 1960 a fountain made of Istrian stone was built as a symbol of potable water supply to Pula from the source in the Raša valley.		-0.3
The park has yet another peculiarity.		-0.3
It is the octagonal Roman mausoleum from the 1st century built at the site of the Roman necropolis.		-0.3
Shrubs of tamarisk, oleander and spirea are a magnificent floral sight inviting to pleasure, while the gracious bell-like white yucca flowers on a long stem “break” the grayness of the chilly autumn days.		-0.3
Beautiful floral groups of annuals of decorative sage, marigold and ageratum bloom every summer in all rainbow colors, and in early spring the spectrum of pansy and daisy colors brings life into the gray and green shrubs of lavender and santolina.		-0.3
The entire park is presently dominated by the beautiful Atlas cedar (Cedrus atlantica glauca) with bluish needles of extremely regular crown and trunk.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The construction of the park began in the 1940s and was completed in 1953.		-0.3
In the front part along the sea a monument in memory of the fallen fighters by Vanja Radauš was erected here in 1957.	Austrougarski car Franjo Josip I. s osobitom je pozorno&scaron;ću pratio projektiranje mornaričke crkve u Puli.	0.290722
This very popular park provides rest on its benches to the elder visitors in the shade of the impressive plane-trees and pines all year round.		-0.3
Besides the Aleppo pine, its majority is formed of flowering shrubs of spirea, Judas tree, tamarisk, oleander and Japanese cherry that with its beautiful colors liven the area during its flowering in spring and summer.		-0.3
Oleander shrub is a recognizable species of the Mediterranean climate, that by its flowering throughout the summer attracts the attention of passers-by.		-0.3
The green parts of this plant are poisonous and one should be careful that the white juice the plant releases does not come in contact with the mucous membrane.		-0.3
In the botanical world this species counts for an indicator of water, as it feels the presence of water even if it is deeper under ground.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The central motif in the park was a fountain where a brass statue of Cupid was put up in 1897.		-0.3
It was removed after several years and in 1904 replaced by a statue of the Austrian Empress Elisabeth.		-0.3
The statue was destroyed and removed in 1934 and in 1940 replaced by the Roman she-wolf with Romulus and Remus.	Bio je nazočan i pri postavljanju kamena temeljca 1891. godine, na Stoji, u pulskoj četvrti San Polikarpo.	0.3
After World War II the Italian government removed it and in 1953, at that very site, a monument representing the Sailor, in honor of the mutiny of sailors in 1918, was erected, but again this monument was removed in 1995.		-0.3
During the Italian rule the park was named after Prince Umberto.	Svečana inauguracija Gospe od Mora obavljena je 1898. godine.	0.3
Species planted in this park were similar to those at Monte Zaro.	Projektom je obuhvaćen i okoli&scaron; sa skalinadom prema moru.	0.283636
One finds here cedar, cypress, yucca, chusan palm, European fan palm, laurel, oleander, yew and guelder rose.		-0.3
Yew (Taxus baccata) is a protected plant species in Croatia, so it is a real treasure to have such beautiful specimens as park heritage.	Danas ju posebnom čini vanjski izgled s uzdužnim redovima od bijelog brijunskog kamena i rumenog mramora iz Oprtlja i Brtonigle.	0.294643
Everything on it is poisonous except the decorative scarlet fleshy aril enclosing the seeds.	Njezini mozaici podsjećaju na porečku baziliku Eufrazijanu i baziliku svetoga Marka u Veneciji.	0.2775
On the same plant are both male and female flowers, so nearby there should be specimens of both sex for the plant to bear fruit.		-0.3
Yew is ideal for trimming and forming various shapes and also adapts well to city conditions.	Pred portalom Gospe od mora pozornost privlače stupovi svezani u mornarski, Samsonov uzao.	0.296203
Here, just as in Naval Park (Mornarički park), there are fine specimens of the coast sequoia, exotic species that will surely attract every visitor’s attention.		-0.3
Common or Mediterranean cypress (Cupressus sempervirens) is a species found in almost all the parks of Pula.	Crkve ~~~ Franjo Josip I. s osobitom je pozorno&scaron;ću pratio projektiranje mornaričke crkve u Puli.	-0.0032967
It is represented in two forms, horizontal and distinctly pyramidal, that is used as a vertical when designing parks.		-0.3
A well-known fact is that even ancient Greeks and Romans used cypress branches for disinfecting their homes.	Bio je nazočan i pri postavljanju kamena temeljca 1891. godine, na Stoji, u pulskoj četvrti San Polikarpo.	0.3
Apart from this, cypress essential oil is very useful for restoring the immune system; it is efficient when dealing with respiratory diseases and circulation and has an extremely soothing effect.		-0.3
Yucca (Yucce gloriosa) originates from North and Central America.		-0.3
Its large, white and upright flowers already in late winter draw everyone’s attention.		-0.3
Today, just as a century ago, the most represented species in this park are laurel shrubs that are clipped and trimmed skillfully in various forms.		-0.3
Laurel (Laurus nobilis) is a typical species for this region, which grows in areas between Mediterranean and semi-Mediterranean forests.		-0.3
It has lush cluster-like yellow flowers, whereas its leaves, wood and fruit are rich in essential oil.		-0.3
Therefore, one should have it nearby because of its therapeutic effect in the treatment of respiratory diseases.		-0.3
Laurel essential oil used as an air purifier helps to prevent infections.		-0.3
Apart from this, it is an essential spice used in preparing Mediterranean specialties, as it adds a special flavor.		-0.3
It is also believed that laurel protects from lightning, evil and contagious diseases, so it was often planted near houses.		-0.3
Laurel leaves have long since been a symbol of military glory, but resurrection as well, so ancient Romans used to adorn their doors with laurel wreaths for New Year.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Svečana inauguracija Gospe od Mora obavljena je 1898. godine.	0.289091
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Projektom je obuhvaćen i okoli&scaron; sa skalinadom prema moru.	0.294737
In the second half of the 19th century the city began to spread to the north and east, so the building of residential areas was accompanied by the concept of creating green oases in those parts of the city.		-0.3
Since the spreading of the city to the north was limited by the existing bay (Valle del Ponte), during the Austro-Hungarian rule this part of the coast, so-called mandrač (tiny port), was filled up and reclaimed.		-0.3
Such an area was then used to design a park, which was to meet the needs of future residents.		-0.3
In close proximity of City Park (Gradski park), the first city hotel “Riviera” was built at the beginning of the 20th century, which is even today considered a true gem of Secession.		-0.3
The park opposite the hotel was also called Riviera, and in 1918 both parks were named after the Italian Queen and called Parco Regina Elena.	Danas ju posebnom čini vanjski izgled s uzdužnim redovima od bijelog brijunskog kamena i rumenog mramora iz Oprtlja i Brtonigle.	0.283929
Villas Münz, with mostly prosperous residents, were already built next to the hotel, thus such a public garden in the surrounding area was simply a must.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
Today, there are about 20 plant species and the most numerous are laurel, guelder rose, Aleppo pine and cedar.		-0.3
Among the cedars are Atlas cedar, Himalayan cedar and the most impressive – the cedar of Lebanon.	Njezini mozaici podsjećaju na porečku baziliku Eufrazijanu i baziliku svetoga Marka u Veneciji.	0.292857
The easiest way to distinguish them is by the arrangement of branches in relation to the trunk.		-0.3
The Atlas cedar has branches growing slantingly towards the top, the top of the Himalayan cedar, as well as the tips of its branches bend downward, whereas the branches of the cedar of Lebanon are vertical to the trunk so the crown has a wide umbrella-like form, resembling somewhat a Japanese pagoda.		-0.3
This last species is highly esteemed in shipping and there are specimens over 1,000 years old.		-0.3
Another well-represented conifer is the Aleppo pine (Pinus halepensis ) which is very significant for this area since it endures salt well and therefore is often planted near the sea.		-0.3
Apart from that, it is ideal for afforesting and is often used as a so-called pioneer species to prepare the ground for other higher quality specimens.		-0.3
This is a typical Mediterranean species, which is autochthonous in our southern coastal region.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The first city park dates from 1863.		-0.3
It is situated between today’s Arsenalska, Rizzijeva and Besenghijeva streets.		-0.3
It covers an area of about 12,000 m2 and has a rectangular form.		-0.3
The paths are covered with gravel and account for more than a third of the park’s entire area.	Pred portalom Gospe od mora pozornost privlače stupovi svezani u mornarski, Samsonov uzao	0.296203
In 1876, on the largest central plateau a marble column, several meters high, was erected in honor of Archduke Maximilian, commander in chief of the Austrian navy, brother of Franz Joseph II, so the park was at that time called Maximilian’s Park.		-0.3
Until 1914 it contained specimens of 63 different plant species that were brought by ships from all over the world.	Trobrodna crkva Rođenja Blažene Djevice Marije podignuta je 1336.godine na temeljima crkvice iz 11. stoljeća.	0.293814
Some of them have survived and can still be seen today.		-0.3
When Pula came under the Italian rule, the park changed its name into Naval Park (Mornarički park), and in 1919 the statue of Maximilian was taken to Venice.		-0.3
During the Italian rule each plant had its name in Latin, German and vernacular, and in 1956 all the names were listed in Italian and Croatian.		-0.3
At the time it was even called Botanical Park.		-0.3
Today it contains some 40 plant species.		-0.3
Especially interesting and valuable are specimens of exotic coast sequoia (Sequoia sempervirens).		-0.3
It has a slender, tall trunk and very unusual bark up to 30 cm thick which is soft under pressure and deeply furrowed, so it protects the cambium from fire.		-0.3
Its cones are small and the needles soft. ~~~ The sequoia grows on the Pacific Coast and California, and in its natural habitat can reach a height of up to 100 meters, so it is among the tallest conifers and along with the eucalyptus ranks among true green giants.		-0.3
Impressive and well-preserved specimens of pines (Pinus pinea) are interesting not only because of their delicious and edible seeds – pine nuts, but also their distinctively regular umbrella-like crown in older trees and deeply furrowed reddish-brown bark that peels off in thick plates.		-0.3
Its cones are thick and large, and the seeds mature in autumn of the second year, whereas the cones split open in spring of its third year.		-0.3
The seeds are very tasty raw, but roasted as well, so they are often added to various sauces served with gastronomic delicacies		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Obnavljana je u vi&scaron;e navrata, a posljednji put 1993. godine.	0.289474
During the Austro-Hungarian rule, mostly allochthonous plant species and exotic species were planted in the pubic gardens of Pula, while only few were autochthonous, and are found in these parks even today.		-0.3
Although among the mentioned species brought from abroad are those that were not able to adapt to the new pedological-climatic conditions, so they either did not survive or they are in a poor state today, there is also a considerable number of those planted in that period, that are found in city parks today and truly have an ornamental function.		-0.3
The period of Italian rule was also characterized by planting of mainly allochthonous species, which in their country of origin had ecological conditions very similar to ours.		-0.3
Most of them acclimatized and adapted to the new surroundings very well, so they are well represented in the parks of Pula today.	Na njeno pročelje 1604. godine postavljen je venecijanski lav s kuglom u ustima - simbol priznavanja vlasti Mlečana u Labinu.	0.297222
The older citizens of Pula vividly remember their city as a wonderful green oasis on the very south of the Istrian Peninsula.		-0.3
One will often hear them talk about bygone days, mentioning benches in parks, murmur of water from the fountains in Naval Park (Mornarički park) or at Monte Zaro, as well as the impeccably clipped hedge in all parks of that time.		-0.3
The trend today is to restore at least part of their onetime splendor.		-0.3
From the old postcards and photographs of the city of Pula, one regretfully sees that a greater part of such treasure has been lost forever.		-0.3
Today, parks are mainly used for easier and quicker communication between destination points, but rarely as a stopping point.	Potkraj tog stojeća, 1688. godine na isto se pročelje postavlja barokni kip senatora Antonia Bollania, ratnika protiv Turaka.	0.291667
Exceptions are certain age groups (children and pensioners) that spend a greater part of their free time in parks.		-0.3
Parks are only a small part of the rich cultural and historical heritage of Pula during the 3,000 years of its existence and therefore present an irreplaceable ornament with the valuable collection of plant species almost 150 years old.		-0.3
Owing to the mild climate and more or less successful selection of species, many of them, although exotic species or allochthonous, have survived until today so in their new habitat they have features of neophytes (flower, fructify and propagate without man’s help).		-0.3
Over the past several years the old topiary technique of trimming and clipping plants in parks is being introduced again.		-0.3
These parks were once designed in such a way and the plant species present enable that technique.	To je poprsje jedan od najljep&scaron;ih primjera svjetovnog kiparstva Istre u 17. stojeću.	0.296296
So, the parks of Pula are once again regaining their characteristic appearance.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
A tour of the sights of Pula would not be complete without a stroll through its well-preserved and beautifully designed parks.	Desno od crkve nalazi se palača poznate plemenita&scaron;ke obitelji Schampicchio, koja je kapelicom povezana uz župnu crkvu.	0.285981
Each and every one of them tells a different story from a certain period of Pula’s history.		-0.3
So, every visitor is eager to unveil some guarded secret or love story and take it along back with him.		-0.3
This is just that little “something” needed to round off the complete sensation.		-0.3
Not all parks were designed at the same time, therefore their style and arrangement are different.		-0.3
Some have a regular pattern, with plants clipped and trimmed in various geometrical forms, others are more “casual”, both by their concept and plant species they contain.		-0.3
Most of today’s parks of Pula originate from the Austro-Hungarian period, whereas the period of the Italian rule and more recent times have left only minor traces in the public garden culture of the city.		-0.3
All parks which developed during that period have a characteristic well-planned arrangement of paths, water supply system and a professional selection of plants.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
Nearby, at Labinska Street 2a is Lidl, and if you continue straight through the roundabout, towards the city center, there are two other shopping centers: Kaufland (Jurja Žakna 3) and Plodine (Jurja Žakna 12). ~~~ Shopping center Billa is at Santorijeva 13.		-0.3
Four times a year there are special shopping offers in Pula when most shops in the city center offer at least a 15% discount on all merchandise.		-0.3
Late Night Shopping, in June brings a music program and fashion show to the city center, which surely makes shopping (shops are open until midnight) more enjoyable and fun.		-0.3
This year it will be held on June 22. ~~~ Shopping on St. Nicholas Day  is associated with St. Nicholas Day- December 2.	Crkvu Rođenja Blažene Djevice Marije krasi &scaron;est mramornih oltara, među kojima i oltar s relikvijama Sv.	0
This year it will be held on December 3.	Justa prenijete 1664. godine iz Rima.	0.3
This shopping event is usually held on Saturday or Sunday. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Glavni oltar ima palu s likovima Blažene Djevice Marije, Svete Paoline i Svetaca Justa, Sergeja, Julijana, Tome i Jakova.	-0.00428571
Pula’s restaurants offer a variety of great delicacies		-0.3
In Pula, just as in most towns of Istria, be sure to taste seafood specialties, of which frogfish, sea bass or delicious stewed savory buzara with Kvarner scampi are just some of the offered delicacies.		-0.3
You should also try clams in Pula, because owing to the clean sea the local ones are especially tasty.		-0.3
Oysters are delicious too; the only thing to add is a few drops of lemon.		-0.3
In Pula you should also try maneštra, traditional thick soup, the main ingredients of which are potatoes and beans with pešt (bacon and garlic roux).		-0.3
This delicacy is even tastier when bobići (young corn) or crumbled corn is added, and just as delicious with chickpeas and barley.		-0.3
When cooking maneštra very often the bone of Istrian prosciutto is put inside.		-0.3
Another specific taste is achieved if it is prepared with young fennel.		-0.3
Jota is a variety of maneštra in which, apart from the basic ingredients of potatoes and beans, sauerkraut is added.		-0.3
The influence of Italian cuisine in Istria is best felt in different types of tasty pasta offered in Pula.		-0.3
The most popular are fuži and gnocchi.		-0.3
Fuži are made with eggs, flour and water.	Autor je Natale Schiavone rodom iz Dalmacije.	0.266667
The mixture is then kneaded into smooth dough, which is rolled out and cut into rectangular shapes and then folded over.		-0.3
Gnocchi are prepared with flour, eggs and potatoes kneaded into dough.		-0.3
Fuži and gnocchi are usually served with various sauces, locally known as šugo.		-0.3
The most traditional one is žgvacet, sauce made with onions, tomatoes, chicken and seasoning. ~~~ In addition to fuži and gnocchi be sure to taste other delicious types of pasta like ravioli, pljukanci, pasutice or makaruni na žlicu.	Mnogo vrednija je slika na oltaru Majke Božje Karmelske iz 17. stoljeća, koji se pripisuje proslavljenom slikaru Jacopu Negritiju, poznatijem kao Palma Mlađi.	0.0314655
Ravioli is pasta with different types of filling, a special type is definitely Labin krafi.. A recommended dish for vegetarians is posutice with fresh cabbage, which has a specific taste when olive oil and garlic are added.		-0.3
At the end of the meal in Pula you will be offered simple yet very tasty sweets, the most traditional and typical ones are kroštule, fritule and cukerančići.		-0.3
On the other hand, if you are served povetica (walnut roll) or peaches be sure to taste them.		-0.3
The perfect wine to accompany dessert and fulfill this experience is typical Istrian Muscat, a wine with a strong characteristic flavor and semi-sweet bouquet.		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule		-0.3
The first and only indoor laser tag arena in Istria.		-0.3
The fully air-conditioned 200m2 indoor-arena is designed for up to 10 players and is located in the very center of Pula, just 100 meters from the famous Amphitheater.		-0.3
When compared to paintball, laser tag is painless because it uses no physical projectiles.		-0.3
Furthermore laser tag is more dynamic, as players do not drop out when they get a hit.		-0.3
Instead, their equipment deactivates for few seconds after which the player is back in the game.		-0.3
All in all it is a game filled with fun, action, tactics, strategy, teamwork and naturally a healthy dose of sports competition, sutable for all generations who are looking for adventure. ~~~ 		-0.3
Price: 70 kn  per person for 15 minutes, 100 kn per person for 30 min, 150 kn per person for 60 min		-0.3

Would you like to find out more about traditional Istrian cuisine, and what ingredients were part of everyday Istrian meals?		-0.3
Roll up your sleeves and learn how to prepare a delicious and  healthy meal!	Autor slika Križnog puta je labinski slikar Valentin Lukas iz 19. stojeća.	0.295385
The Ethnographic Museum of Istria / Museo Etnografico dell’Istria and the House of Istrian Olive Oil are organizing salad preparation workshops during the month of September 2017.		-0.3
Every Wednesday, following a short presentation on traditional Istrian cuisine, the participants will learn how to prepare a typical Istrian seasonal salad with locally grown ingredients (radicchio, rucola, tomatoes and cucumbers to name just a few).		-0.3
You will also learn how to dress it using organic extra virgin olive oil and finally, enjoy what you have created!		-0.3

The members of the association Spectacula gladiatoria last weekend (from 16<sup>th</sup> to 18<sup>th</sup> September) visited Tivoli, nearby Rome, where they were invited to participate to the tournament that revoked gladiatorial games.		-0.3
The school Spectacula gladiatoria earned most points and won the first prize.	Iznad vrata s unutra&scaron;nje strane otkrivena je gotička freska.	0.270492
Spectacula gladiatorial started activities in 2013, the same time as the program Spectacula antiqva, thanks to the efforts and interest of the Tourist Office of the City of Pula, the Archeological Museum of Istria and the company Pula spot d.o.o.		-0.3
One of the visions in creating the project is to make the Pula exhibition the best in the world, and that is proved also by this prize, in particular the fact that it was won in Rome, thanks to the domination over the local school Ludus Magnus.		-0.3
Spectacula gladiatoria is, traditionally, the holder of the program Spectacvula Antiqva, a program which, with about a dozen manifestations in Summer attracts to the amphitheater in Pula more than 22,000 visitors, both domestic and foreign, and  has become a reason for visiting Pula and the Arena and, considering that the project is completely self-financed and the number of targeted visits, it has overcome similar projects both in Croatia and in Europe.		-0.3
At the moment in Europe there are about ten gladiatorial and about twenty cultural societies dealing with the period of the antiquity, whose members are all passionate lovers of the ancient period, the most important one both for the old and the new era.		-0.3
The Antiquity left deep traces in the European and whole western culture and in the 20<sup>th</sup> and 21<sup>st</sup> century it has become the mainstay in creating the identity of the majority of west European cities and, at the same time, the brand used for promotional purposes in tourism, sports, culture, science and economy.		-0.3
Those achievements confirm the correct orientation in creating the programmatic identity and brand of the City of Pula and Istria, among other as a destination of cultural tourism and history. ~~~ 6. October 2017. ~~~ The South Istria tourist boards (Pula, Vodnjan, Medulin, Fažana, Ližnjan, Marčana and Barban) are organising 6 cycling tours with the aim of popularising cycling and presenting bike trails in the south of Istria.<u> ~~~ </u>The tours are suitable for participants of all ages.		-0.3
We invite entire families to join us. ~~~ Individual routes are between 20 and 25 km long and are not technically demanding.	Budući da je crkva renovirana, danas se u njoj nalazi sakralna zbirka s značajnim eksponatima, primjerice, slikom Mučenje Sv.	-0.0116505

September 2017. ~~~ All rights reserved &copy; 2018 Turistička zajednica grada Pule	Na kraju ulice, koja s Placa vodi između crkve Majke Bojže i kapele sv.	-0.0105263
The Glagolitic script is an ancient Slavic script, which was createdat the beginning of ninth century and was used until the early 19 century when an increasing role was given to Latin alphabet.		-0.3
The Glagolitic alphabet was initially rounded, then squared and then had 32 characters. ~~~ It has a numerical value so that the first nine letters are ones and the following nine letters are tens,further nine letters are hundreds and following nine letters are thousands.The strongest bases of theGlagolitic are: Croatian Adriatic coast, Istriaand the island of Krk, where the oldest stone monuments have been found, from the 12thand 13th century: Valunska tablet, Plomin inscription, Grdoselski and Supetar fragment and the Ba&scaron;ka Tablet.		-0.3
Glagolitic	Antuna, crkva je sv.	0.109091
The Glagolitic script is an ancient Slavic script, which was createdat the beginning of ninth century and was used until the early 19 century when an increasing role was given to Latin alphabet.		-0.3
The Glagolitic alphabet was initially rounded, then squared and then had 32 characters.	Eufemije , podignuta 1383. godine, te temeljito obnovljena 1864.	0.2
It has a numerical value so that the first nine letters are ones and the following nine letters are tens,further nine letters are hundreds and following nine letters are thousands.The strongest bases of theGlagolitic are: Croatian Adriatic coast, Istriaand the island of Krk, where the oldest stone monuments have been found, from the 12thand 13th century: Valunska tablet, Plomin inscription, Grdoselski and Supetar fragment		-0.3
Constantine Cyril.With it,the church books, town statutes and laws, carvings on the walls, carved messages on crucifixes, even on church bells, were written.		-0.3
Today it is a priceless heritage, the best preserved exactly in the central Istrian region.The modernagehas built a unique monument of Glagolitic culture and literacy - the Glagolitic Alley with eleven memorials which have been set up along the road between the smalltowns of Roč and Hum		-0.3
The basilica in Betiga, left of the road between the village and the new tourist village, is dedicated to St. Andrew.		-0.3
Only some parts of the wall and the shrine are what was left from the basilica, including a stone trefoil and a floor mosaic (about a hundred square meters) which used to cover some 25 meters in length.		-0.3
After that there was a Benedictine monastery there until the 13th century when the plague came to this area.		-0.3
Churches ~~~ A Late-Gothic church of the Mother of God, dominating the Square, was built to the right side of the Town Gate by Master Dento in 1425 to the order of the local villager-nobleman Petar Beračić.		-0.3
This fact witnesses that in the Middle Ages there was a privileged class, which had money to build churches, but also profane building such as the Salomon Place.	U njoj se danas čuvaju monumentalno raspelo iz 13. stoljeća i obnovljen oltar Bogorodice Za&scaron;titnice iz crkve Majke Bojže na Placu.	0.265289
The internal eastern wall of the church is covered over its whole length by a large wall painting depicting the Adoration of the Magi, originating from the same period.		-0.3
Many would ask what the nails driven between the blocks of the external wall of this beautiful church mean.		-0.3
The legend says that over the times, on the Solemnity of the Assumption of Mary, childless women would drive in the nails believing that they would conceive by Devine Mercy.		-0.3
Churches	Od crkve sv.	0.233333
Chapel of St. AnthonyNext to the Church stands the Chapel of St. Anthony, built by Master Almerigo in 1381 with regularly cut stone blocks.		-0.3
The Chapel was renovated in 1486 by Pascasius, Bishop of Pićan, born at Grači&scaron;će.		-0.3
St. Agatha's Church lies at the old city cemetery.	Eufemije prema jugu proteže se ulica Pod Fumiju.	0.3
With its trefoil apse, it is an example of Romanesque sacral architecture.		-0.3
Its construction with three naves, a saddle roof and a specific sanctuary that extends through the choir of the central apse, make it especially interesting.		-0.3
The church is dated to the period between the 9th and the 13th century.		-0.3
In addition to Carolingian influences, it also bears features typical of the regional sacral architecture of the Middle Ages.	Bila je to ulica obrtnika, a jedan od njih kovač - nad svojim je vratima uz godinu 1451. uklesao - čekić, simbol svog zanata.	0.44434
Its interior harbours two Late Baroque sculptures of local origin (light-bearing angels) and an altar depiction of St. Agatha. Churches	Crkve	0.15
At the end of the street leading from the Square, between the Church of the Mother of God and the Chapel of St. Anthony, is the Church of St. Euphemia, built in 1383 and thoroughly renovated in 1864.		-0.3
The church still keeps the monumental crucifix from the 13th century and the renovated altar of the Mother of God, Patron of the Church of the Mother of God na Placu.		-0.3
From the church of St. Euphemia to the south stretches the Pod Fumiju Street.	Na cesti prema Fažani nalazi se crkva sv.	0.0583333
It was the street of craftsmen and one of them, a blacksmith, engraved a hammer, the symbol of his craft, over his door next to the year 1451.		-0.3
The Street, which has retained its original appearance without major modifications, led out of the town through the South Gate, next to the recently renovated and impressive round tower built around 1500.		-0.3
It was through this Gate that the poljanci &ndash; the inhabitants of the surrounding villages entered the town looking for the services of craftsmen. ~~~ Churches		-0.3
This small church is the most interesting sacral structure in the Buzet area, since it is defined by three periods and phases of construction.		-0.3
The rectangular Romanesque nave was built first, then the late-Romanesque presbytery was added on the eastern side.	Antuna, opata i pustinjaka, vjerojatno iz 13. stoljeća.	0

Churches ~~~ On the east part of the square, the Parish Church of Annunciation is situated. ~~~ It was built in the early 16th century and has a Renaissance trefoil facade made of domestic dressed stone. The interior is distinguished by five marble altars with altar paintings all belonging to Venetian school.Especially valuable are the altar of St. Victoria with the painting showing the Mother of Lord with angels, altars of St. Sebastian and St. Roch, work of Palma Junior, and the main altar with the altar painting of the Annunciation, the work of Guiseppe Porto- Salviati, commissioned by the Grimany family.		-0.3

Churches ~~~ Beside the old Roman road below the village of Batvači there is the Church of Saint Fo&scaron;ka (6th -7th century).		-0.3
The basilica was built from two parts: from a narrow and ascetically shadowy church with three naves divided with short pillars and an ethereal lodge which was a sanctuary for many pilgrims coming from all over.		-0.3

Churches	Crkve	0.15
On the road to Fažana lies the Church of St. Anthony, abbot and hermit, probably from the 13th century.		-0.3
Since the economy of Vodnjan in the past was based on cattle breeding, as protector of domestic animals, the church bears dedication to this saint.		-0.3
The church is an aisleless edifice with an apse.		-0.3
Its walls still show fragments of frescoes from the 13th and 14th centuries.		-0.3
Oxen and cows were brought for benediction on the saint's feast day, while blessed salt was carried home for other animals.		-0.3
Owing to the Vodnjan benefactor Angelo Cecon, the church was renovated in 1894 and a retirement home was built at the site.		-0.3

	Gradska loža u Grožnjanu datira na kraj 16. stoljeća, a u pro&scaron;losti je u njoj zasjedao sud.Povijesna jezgra Grožnjana obiluje vrijednim i starim kućama, a jedna od najzanimljivijih očuvanih građevina iz venecijanskog razdoblja je gradska loža.	-0.3
	Kad se prođe kroz gradska vrata iz 15. stoljeća, odmah je uočljiva renesansna gradska loža iz 1587. godine.	-0.3
	Loža ima četiri stupa i pod od vapnenca, a u njoj se nalaze četiri rimske nadgrobne ploče.	-0.3
	Ovdje je u pro&scaron;losti zasjedao sud, budući da je Grožnjan imao vlastiti statut, sastavljen na talijanskom u notarskom spisu iz 1558. i podijeljen na četiri knjige.	-0.3
	Iznad lože nalazio se fontik, odnosno gradsko skladi&scaron;te namirnica.	-0.3

Poreč	Poreč	1.8
One of the most impressive structures in Vodnjan and entire Istria is certainly the parish church of St. Blaise, well-known to pilgrims from all over the world.		-0.3
On the site of the present-day parish church once stood a basilica, most probably from the 11th century, that was pulled down in 1760.		-0.3
The new church was modelled after the Venetian church of San Pietro, and the project itself cost 13,000 gold coins.	Jedna od najimpozantnijih građevina u Vodnjanu, ali i cijeloj Istri je svakako župna crkva sv.	0.249398
The church was financed by the townspeople and its construction lasted from 1760 to 1800.	Blaža koju posjećuju hodočasnici iz cijelog svijeta.	0.144
At that time the locals set aside 10% for the building of the church, whereas over the next ten years they set aside 10% of wine and olive oil.	Na mjestu dana&scaron;anje župne crkve nalazila se bazilika, najvjerojatnije iz 11. stoljeća, koja je poru&scaron;ena 1760. godine.	0.294828
Today this church is the largest and one of the most magnificent ones in Istria.		-0.3
Istrian building heritage of the Venetian era	Nova je crkva građena prema modelu crkve sv.	0.292308
The core of the Communal or Town Palace, the site of present-day town administration, dates from the 16th century.		-0.3
During the course of time, the palace was frequently changed, even decreased in size in the 19th century.		-0.3
Its foundations date back to 1308, when it was the Praetorian Palace.	Petra u Veneciji, a projekt je bio vrijedan 13.000 zlatnih dukata.	0.289474
The large Town Council Hall, offices and the archives occupied the first floor.		-0.3
The mural painting from 1580 depicting the allegory of the town administration had been somewhat preserved, recently restored and put on the town council walls.		-0.3
In one of its phases, the building was used as a prison, located on the ground floor.		-0.3
The facade of the town or the communal palace is red, additionally emphasized by a white stone portal, windows and stone plates.		-0.3
The covered walkway through the old town gates was knocked down in 1822.	Crkvu je Vodnjanu poklonio narod i gradila se od 1760. do 1800. godine.	0.295
The facade and the atrium were renovated between 1850 and 1860, when a number of Venetian and Rovinj family crests was put up, including the town coat of arms.		-0.3
The facade underwent another renovation in 1935, which has given the palace its present appearance. ~~~ How to get there:It is located in the near vicinity of the central town square - the Square of Marshal Tito.	U to vrijeme građani su odvajali 10 posto svih proizvoda za gradnju crkve, a daljnih deset godina izdvajali su deset posto vina i maslinovog ulja.	0.00919305
It is reached by passing through the Balbi Arch.	Danas je ova crkva najveća i jedna od najznačajnijih u Istri.	0.204878
Trg Matteotti 2, HR-52210 Rovinj-Rovigno<a href="http://www.rovinj.hr/rovinj/index.php" target="_blank">www.rovinj.hr</a>		-0.3
